125std::string get_ascii_tile_id( const uint32_t sym, const int FG, const int BG )
126{
127 return std::string( { 'A', 'S', 'C', 'I', 'I', '_', static_cast<char>( sym ), static_cast<char>( FG ), static_cast<char>( BG ) } );
128}
129
130pixel_minimap_mode pixel_minimap_mode_from_string( const std::string &mode )
131{
132 if( mode == "solid" ) {
133 return pixel_minimap_mode::solid;
134 } else if( mode == "squares" ) {
135 return pixel_minimap_mode::squares;
136 } else if( mode == "dots" ) {
137 return pixel_minimap_mode::dots;
138 }
139
140 debugmsg( "Unsupported pixel minimap mode \"" + mode + "\"." );
141 return pixel_minimap_mode::solid;
142}

146static int msgtype_to_tilecolor( const game_message_type type, const bool bOldMsg )
147{
148 const int iBold = bOldMsg ? 0 : 8;
149
150 switch( type ) {
151 case m_good:
152 return iBold + catacurses::green;
153 case m_bad:
154 return iBold + catacurses::red;
155 case m_mixed:
156 case m_headshot:
157 return iBold + catacurses::magenta;
158 case m_neutral:
159 return iBold + catacurses::white;
160 case m_warning:
161 case m_critical:
162 return iBold + catacurses::yellow;
163 case m_info:
164 case m_grazing:
165 return iBold + catacurses::blue;
166 default:
167 break;
168 }
169
170 return -1;
171}

173formatted_text::formatted_text( const std::string &text, const int color,
174 const direction text_direction )
175 : text( text ), color( color )
176{
177 switch( text_direction ) {
178 case direction::NORTHWEST:
179 case direction::WEST:
180 case direction::SOUTHWEST:
181 alignment = text_alignment::right;
182 break;
183 case direction::NORTH:
184 case direction::CENTER:
185 case direction::SOUTH:
186 alignment = text_alignment::center;
187 break;
188 default:
189 alignment = text_alignment::left;
190 break;
191 }
192}

194void idle_animation_manager::prepare_for_redraw()
195{
196 // Forget about animations from previous frame
197 present_ = false;
198
199 if( !enabled_ ) {
200 frame = 0;
201 return;
202 }
203
204 // Use system clock to keep steady frame rate
205 auto now = std::chrono::system_clock::now();
206 auto now_ms = std::chrono::time_point_cast<std::chrono::milliseconds>( now );
207 auto value = now_ms.time_since_epoch();
208 // Aiming roughly at the standard 60 frames per second
209 frame = value.count() / 17;
210}

212struct tile_render_info {
213 tripoint pos{};
214 // accumulator for 3d tallness of sprites rendered here so far;
215 int height_3d = 0;
216 lit_level ll;
217 bool invisible[5];
218 tile_render_info( const tripoint &pos, const int height_3d, const lit_level ll,
219 const bool( &invisible )[5] )
220 : pos( pos ), height_3d( height_3d ), ll( ll ) {
221 std::copy( invisible, invisible + 5, this->invisible );
222 }
223};

256void cata_tiles::on_options_changed()
257{
258 memory_map_mode = get_option <std::string>( "MEMORY_MAP_MODE" );
259
260 pixel_minimap_settings settings;
261
262 settings.mode = pixel_minimap_mode_from_string( get_option<std::string>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_MODE" ) );
263 settings.brightness = get_option<int>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_BRIGHTNESS" );
264 settings.beacon_size = get_option<int>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_BEACON_SIZE" );
265 settings.beacon_blink_interval = get_option<bool>( "ANIMATIONS" ) ?
266 get_option<int>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_BLINK" ) : 0;
267 settings.square_pixels = get_option<bool>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_RATIO" );
268 settings.scale_to_fit = get_option<bool>( "PIXEL_MINIMAP_SCALE_TO_FIT" );
269
270 minimap->set_settings( settings );
271}

273const tile_type *tileset::find_tile_type( const std::string &id ) const
274{
275 const auto iter = tile_ids.find( id );
276 return iter != tile_ids.end() ? &iter->second : nullptr;

278
279cata::optional<tile_lookup_res>
280tileset::find_tile_type_by_season( const std::string &id, season_type season ) const
281{
282 assert( season < season_type::NUM_SEASONS );
283 const auto iter = tile_ids_by_season[season].find( id );
284
285 if( iter == tile_ids_by_season[season].end() ) {
286 return cata::nullopt;
287 }
288 auto &res = iter->second;
289 if( res.season_tile ) {
290 return *res.season_tile;
291 } else if( res.default_tile ) { // can skip this check, but just in case
292 return tile_lookup_res( iter->first, *res.default_tile );
293 }
294 debugmsg( "empty record found in `tile_ids_by_season` for key: %s", id );
295 return cata::nullopt;
296}
297
298tile_type &tileset::create_tile_type( const std::string &id, tile_type &&new_tile_type )
299{
300 // Must overwrite existing tile
301 // TODO: c++17 - replace [] + find() with insert_or_assign()
302 tile_ids[id] = std::move( new_tile_type );
303 auto inserted = tile_ids.find( id );
304
305 const std::string &inserted_id = inserted->first;
306 tile_type &inserted_tile = inserted->second;
307
308 // populate cache by season
309 constexpr size_t suffix_len = 15;
310 constexpr char season_suffix[4][suffix_len] = {
311 "_season_spring", "_season_summer", "_season_autumn", "_season_winter"
312 };
313 bool has_season_suffix = false;
314 for( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
315 if( string_ends_with( id, season_suffix[i] ) ) {
316 has_season_suffix = true;
317 // key is id without _season suffix
318 season_tile_value &value = tile_ids_by_season[i][id.substr( 0,
319 id.size() - strlen( season_suffix[i] ) )];
320 // value stores reference to string id with _season suffix
321 value.season_tile = tile_lookup_res( inserted_id, inserted_tile );
322 break;
323 }
324 }
325 // tile doesn't have _season suffix, add it as "default" into all four seasons
326 if( !has_season_suffix ) {
327 for( auto &tile_ids_for_season : tile_ids_by_season ) {
328 tile_ids_for_season[id].default_tile = &inserted_tile;
329 }
330 }
331
332 return inserted_tile;
333}
334
335void cata_tiles::load_tileset(
336 const std::string &tileset_id,
337 const std::vector<mod_id> &mod_list,
338 const bool precheck,
339 const bool force,
340 const bool pump_events
341)
342{
343 if( !force && tileset_ptr &&
344 !get_option<bool>( "FORCE_TILESET_RELOAD" ) &&
345 tileset_ptr->get_tileset_id() == tileset_id &&
346 tileset_mod_list_stamp == mod_list
347 ) {
348 return;
349 }
350 // TODO: move into clear or somewhere else.
351 // reset the overlay ordering from the previous loaded tileset
352 tileset_mutation_overlay_ordering.clear();
353
354 // Load the tileset into a separate instance and only set this->tileset_ptr
355 // when the loading has succeeded.
356 std::unique_ptr<tileset> new_tileset_ptr = std::make_unique<tileset>();
357 tileset_loader loader( *new_tileset_ptr, renderer );
358 loader.load( tileset_id, precheck, /*pump_events=*/pump_events );
359 tileset_ptr = std::move( new_tileset_ptr );
360 tileset_mod_list_stamp = mod_list;
361
362 set_draw_scale( 16 );
363
364 minimap->set_type( tile_iso ? pixel_minimap_type::iso : pixel_minimap_type::ortho );
365}
366
367void cata_tiles::reinit()
368{
369 set_draw_scale( 16 );
370 RenderClear( renderer );
371}
372
373static void get_tile_information( const std::string &config_path, std::string &json_path,
374 std::string &tileset_path )
375{
376 const std::string default_json = PATH_INFO::defaulttilejson();
377 const std::string default_tileset = PATH_INFO::defaulttilepng();
378
379 // Get JSON and TILESET vars from config
380 const auto reader = [&]( std::istream & fin ) {
381 while( !fin.eof() ) {
382 std::string sOption;
383 fin >> sOption;
384
385 if( sOption.empty() ) {
386 getline( fin, sOption );
387 } else if( sOption[0] == '#' ) {
388 // Skip comment
389 getline( fin, sOption );
390 } else if( sOption.find( "JSON" ) != std::string::npos ) {
391 fin >> json_path;
392 dbg( DL::Info ) << "JSON path set to [" << json_path << "].";
393 } else if( sOption.find( "TILESET" ) != std::string::npos ) {
394 fin >> tileset_path;
395 dbg( DL::Info ) << "TILESET path set to [" << tileset_path << "].";
396 } else {
397 getline( fin, sOption );
398 }
399 }
400 };
401
402 if( !read_from_file( config_path, reader ) ) {
403 json_path = default_json;
404 tileset_path = default_tileset;
405 }
406
407 if( json_path.empty() ) {
408 json_path = default_json;
409 dbg( DL::Info ) << "JSON set to default [" << json_path << "].";
410 }
411 if( tileset_path.empty() ) {
412 tileset_path = default_tileset;
413 dbg( DL::Info ) << "TILESET set to default [" << tileset_path << "].";
414 }
415}
416
417template<typename PixelConverter>
418static SDL_Surface_Ptr apply_color_filter( const SDL_Surface_Ptr &original,
419 PixelConverter pixel_converter )
420{
421 assert( original );
422 SDL_Surface_Ptr surf = create_surface_32( original->w, original->h );
423 assert( surf );
424 throwErrorIf( SDL_BlitSurface( original.get(), nullptr, surf.get(), nullptr ) != 0,
425 "SDL_BlitSurface failed" );
426
427 auto pix = reinterpret_cast<SDL_Color *>( surf->pixels );
428
429 for( int y = 0, ey = surf->h; y < ey; ++y ) {
430 for( int x = 0, ex = surf->w; x < ex; ++x, ++pix ) {
431 if( pix->a == 0x00 ) {
432 // This check significantly improves the performance since
433 // vast majority of pixels in the tilesets are completely transparent.
434 continue;
435 }
436 *pix = pixel_converter( *pix );
437 }
438 }
439
440 return surf;
441}
442
443static bool is_contained( const SDL_Rect &smaller, const SDL_Rect &larger )
444{
445 return smaller.x >= larger.x &&
446 smaller.y >= larger.y &&
447 smaller.x + smaller.w <= larger.x + larger.w &&
448 smaller.y + smaller.h <= larger.y + larger.h;
449}
450
451bool tileset_loader::copy_surface_to_texture( const SDL_Surface_Ptr &surf, const point &offset,
452 std::vector<texture> &target )
453{
454 assert( surf );
455 const rect_range<SDL_Rect> input_range( sprite_width, sprite_height, point( surf->w / sprite_width,
456 surf->h / sprite_height ) );
457
458 const std::shared_ptr<SDL_Texture> texture_ptr = CreateTextureFromSurface( renderer, surf );
459 if( !texture_ptr ) {
460 return false;
461 }
462
463 for( const SDL_Rect rect : input_range ) {
464 assert( offset.x % sprite_width == 0 );
465 assert( offset.y % sprite_height == 0 );
466 const point pos( offset + point( rect.x, rect.y ) );
467 assert( pos.x % sprite_width == 0 );
468 assert( pos.y % sprite_height == 0 );
469 const size_t index = this->offset + ( pos.x / sprite_width ) + ( pos.y / sprite_height ) *
470 ( tile_atlas_width / sprite_width );
471 assert( index < target.size() );
472 assert( target[index].dimension() == std::make_pair( 0, 0 ) );
473 target[index] = texture( texture_ptr, rect );
474 }
475 return true;
476}
477
478bool tileset_loader::create_textures_from_tile_atlas( const SDL_Surface_Ptr &tile_atlas,
479 const point &offset )
480{
481 assert( tile_atlas );
482
483 /** perform color filter conversion here */
484 using tiles_pixel_color_entry = std::tuple<std::vector<texture>*, std::string>;
485 std::array<tiles_pixel_color_entry, 6> tile_values_data = {{
486 { std::make_tuple( &ts.tile_values, "color_pixel_none" ) },
487 { std::make_tuple( &ts.shadow_tile_values, "color_pixel_grayscale" ) },
488 { std::make_tuple( &ts.night_tile_values, "color_pixel_nightvision" ) },
489 { std::make_tuple( &ts.overexposed_tile_values, "color_pixel_overexposed" ) },
490 { std::make_tuple( &ts.z_overlay_values, "color_pixel_zoverlay" ) },
491 { std::make_tuple( &ts.memory_tile_values, tilecontext->memory_map_mode ) }
492 }
493 };
494 for( tiles_pixel_color_entry &entry : tile_values_data ) {
495 std::vector<texture> *tile_values = std::get<0>( entry );
496 color_pixel_function_pointer color_pixel_function = get_color_pixel_function( std::get<1>
497 ( entry ) );
498 bool success;
499 if( !color_pixel_function ) {
500 // TODO: Move it inside apply_color_filter.
501 success = copy_surface_to_texture( tile_atlas, offset, *tile_values );
502 } else {
503 success = copy_surface_to_texture( apply_color_filter( tile_atlas, color_pixel_function ), offset,
504 *tile_values );
505 }
506 if( !success ) {
507 return false;
508 }
509 }
510 return true;
511}
512
513template<typename T>
514static void extend_vector_by( std::vector<T> &vec, const size_t additional_size )
515{
516 vec.resize( vec.size() + additional_size );
517}
518
519void tileset_loader::load_tileset( const std::string &img_path, const bool pump_events )
520{
521 const SDL_Surface_Ptr tile_atlas = load_image( img_path.c_str() );
522 assert( tile_atlas );
523 tile_atlas_width = tile_atlas->w;
524
525 if( R >= 0 && R <= 255 && G >= 0 && G <= 255 && B >= 0 && B <= 255 ) {
526 const Uint32 key = SDL_MapRGB( tile_atlas->format, 0, 0, 0 );
527 throwErrorIf( SDL_SetColorKey( tile_atlas.get(), SDL_TRUE, key ) != 0, "SDL_SetColorKey failed" );
528 throwErrorIf( SDL_SetSurfaceRLE( tile_atlas.get(), 1 ), "SDL_SetSurfaceRLE failed" );
529 }
530
531 SDL_RendererInfo info;
532 throwErrorIf( SDL_GetRendererInfo( renderer.get(), &info ) != 0, "SDL_GetRendererInfo failed" );
533 // Software rendering stores textures as surfaces with run-length encoding, which makes extracting a part
534 // in the middle of the texture slow. Therefore this "simulates" that the renderer only supports one tile
535 // per texture. Each tile will go on its own texture object.
536 if( info.flags & SDL_RENDERER_SOFTWARE ) {
537 info.max_texture_width = sprite_width;
538 info.max_texture_height = sprite_height;
539 }
540 // for debugging only: force a very small maximal texture size, as to trigger
541 // splitting the tile atlas.
542#if 0
543 // +1 to check correct rounding
544 info.max_texture_width = sprite_width * 10 + 1;
545 info.max_texture_height = sprite_height * 20 + 1;
546#endif
547
548 const int min_tile_xcount = 128;
549 const int min_tile_ycount = min_tile_xcount * 2;
550
551 if( info.max_texture_width == 0 ) {
552 info.max_texture_width = sprite_width * min_tile_xcount;
553 dbg( DL::Info ) <<
554 "SDL_RendererInfo max_texture_width was set to 0. Changing it to " <<
555 info.max_texture_width;
556 } else {
557 throwErrorIf( info.max_texture_width < sprite_width,
558 "Maximal texture width is smaller than tile width" );
559 }
560
561 if( info.max_texture_height == 0 ) {
562 info.max_texture_height = sprite_height * min_tile_ycount;
563 dbg( DL::Info ) <<
564 "SDL_RendererInfo max_texture_height was set to 0. Changing it to "
565 << info.max_texture_height;
566 } else {
567 throwErrorIf( info.max_texture_height < sprite_height,
568 "Maximal texture height is smaller than tile height" );
569 }
570
571 // Number of tiles in each dimension that fits into a (maximal) SDL texture.
572 // If the tile atlas contains more than that, we have to split it.
573 const int max_tile_xcount = info.max_texture_width / sprite_width;
574 const int max_tile_ycount = info.max_texture_height / sprite_height;
575 // Range over the tile atlas, wherein each rectangle fits into the maximal
576 // SDL texture size. In other words: a range over the parts into which the
577 // tile atlas needs to be split.
578 const rect_range<SDL_Rect> output_range(
579 max_tile_xcount * sprite_width,
580 max_tile_ycount * sprite_height,
581 point( divide_round_up( tile_atlas->w, info.max_texture_width ), divide_round_up( tile_atlas->h,
582 info.max_texture_height ) ) );
583
584 const int expected_tilecount = ( tile_atlas->w / sprite_width ) * ( tile_atlas->h / sprite_height );
585 extend_vector_by( ts.tile_values, expected_tilecount );
586 extend_vector_by( ts.shadow_tile_values, expected_tilecount );
587 extend_vector_by( ts.night_tile_values, expected_tilecount );
588 extend_vector_by( ts.overexposed_tile_values, expected_tilecount );
589 extend_vector_by( ts.z_overlay_values, expected_tilecount );
590 extend_vector_by( ts.memory_tile_values, expected_tilecount );
591
592 for( const SDL_Rect sub_rect : output_range ) {
593 assert( sub_rect.x % sprite_width == 0 );
594 assert( sub_rect.y % sprite_height == 0 );
595 assert( sub_rect.w % sprite_width == 0 );
596 assert( sub_rect.h % sprite_height == 0 );
597 SDL_Surface_Ptr smaller_surf;
598
599 if( is_contained( SDL_Rect{ 0, 0, tile_atlas->w, tile_atlas->h }, sub_rect ) ) {
600 // can use tile_atlas directly, it is completely contained in the output rectangle
601 } else {
602 // Need a temporary surface that contains the parts of the tile atlas that fit
603 // into sub_rect. But doesn't always need to be as large as sub_rect.
604 const int w = std::min( tile_atlas->w - sub_rect.x, sub_rect.w );
605 const int h = std::min( tile_atlas->h - sub_rect.y, sub_rect.h );
606 smaller_surf = ::create_surface_32( w, h );
607 assert( smaller_surf );
608 const SDL_Rect inp{ sub_rect.x, sub_rect.y, w, h };
609 throwErrorIf( SDL_BlitSurface( tile_atlas.get(), &inp, smaller_surf.get(), nullptr ) != 0,
610 "SDL_BlitSurface failed" );
611 }
612 const SDL_Surface_Ptr &surf_to_use = smaller_surf ? smaller_surf : tile_atlas;
613 assert( surf_to_use );
614
615 if( !create_textures_from_tile_atlas( surf_to_use, point( sub_rect.x, sub_rect.y ) ) ) {
616 // May happen on some systems - there's nothing we can do about it
617 throw std::runtime_error(
618 _(
619 "Failed to create texture atlas, see debug.log for details. "
620 "This commonly happens if the device is low on memory. "
621 "Try rebooting device, or using another tileset or a different renderer."
622 )
623 );
624 }
625
626 if( pump_events ) {
627 inp_mngr.pump_events();
628 }
629 }
630
631 size = expected_tilecount;
632}
633
634void cata_tiles::set_draw_scale( int scale )
635{
636 assert( tileset_ptr );
637 tile_width = tileset_ptr->get_tile_width() * tileset_ptr->get_tile_pixelscale() * scale / 16;
638 tile_height = tileset_ptr->get_tile_height() * tileset_ptr->get_tile_pixelscale() * scale / 16;
639
640 tile_ratiox = ( static_cast<float>( tile_width ) / static_cast<float>( fontwidth ) );
641 tile_ratioy = ( static_cast<float>( tile_height ) / static_cast<float>( fontheight ) );
642}
643
644void tileset_loader::load( const std::string &tileset_id, const bool precheck,
645 const bool pump_events )
646{
647 std::string json_conf;
648 std::string tileset_path;
649 std::string tileset_root;
650
651 const auto tset_iter = TILESETS.find( tileset_id );
652 if( tset_iter != TILESETS.end() ) {
653 tileset_root = tset_iter->second;
654 dbg( DL::Info ) << '"' << tileset_id << '"' << " tileset: found config file path: " << tileset_root;
655 get_tile_information( tileset_root + '/' + PATH_INFO::tileset_conf(),
656 json_conf, tileset_path );
657 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Current tileset is: " << tileset_id;
658 } else {
659 dbg( DL::Error ) << "Tileset \"" << tileset_id << "\" from options is invalid";
660 json_conf = PATH_INFO::defaulttilejson();
661 tileset_path = PATH_INFO::defaulttilepng();
662 }
663
664 std::string json_path = tileset_root + '/' + json_conf;
665 std::string img_path = tileset_root + '/' + tileset_path;
666
667 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Attempting to Load JSON file " << json_path;
668 std::ifstream config_file( json_path.c_str(), std::ifstream::in | std::ifstream::binary );
669
670 if( !config_file.good() ) {
671 throw std::runtime_error( std::string( "Failed to open tile info json: " ) + json_path );
672 }
673
674 JsonIn config_json( config_file );
675 JsonObject config = config_json.get_object();
676
677 // "tile_info" section must exist.
678 if( !config.has_member( "tile_info" ) ) {
679 config.throw_error( "\"tile_info\" missing" );
680 }
681
682 for( const JsonObject &curr_info : config.get_array( "tile_info" ) ) {
683 ts.tile_height = curr_info.get_int( "height" );
684 ts.tile_width = curr_info.get_int( "width" );
685 tile_iso = curr_info.get_bool( "iso", false );
686 ts.tile_pixelscale = curr_info.get_float( "pixelscale", 1.0f );
687 }
688
689 if( precheck ) {
690 config.allow_omitted_members();
691 return;
692 }
693
694 // Load tile information if available.
695 offset = 0;
696 load_internal( config, tileset_root, img_path, pump_events );
697
698 // Load mod tilesets if available
699 for( const mod_tileset &mts : all_mod_tilesets ) {
700 // Set sprite_id offset to separate from other tilesets.
701 sprite_id_offset = offset;
702 tileset_root = mts.get_base_path();
703 json_path = mts.get_full_path();
704
705 if( !mts.is_compatible( tileset_id ) ) {
706 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Mod tileset in \"" << json_path << "\" is not compatible.";
707 continue;
708 }
709 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Attempting to Load JSON file " << json_path;
710 std::ifstream mod_config_file( json_path.c_str(), std::ifstream::in | std::ifstream::binary );
711
712 if( !mod_config_file.good() ) {
713 throw std::runtime_error( std::string( "Failed to open tile info json: " ) + json_path );
714 }
715
716 JsonIn mod_config_json( mod_config_file );
717
718 const auto mark_visited = []( const JsonObject & jobj ) {
719 // These fields have been visited in load_mod_tileset
720 jobj.get_string_array( "compatibility" );
721 };
722
723 int num_in_file = 1;
724 if( mod_config_json.test_array() ) {
725 for( const JsonObject &mod_config : mod_config_json.get_array() ) {
726 if( mod_config.get_string( "type" ) == "mod_tileset" ) {
727 if( num_in_file == mts.num_in_file() ) {
728 mark_visited( mod_config );
729 load_internal( mod_config, tileset_root, img_path, pump_events );
730 break;
731 }
732 num_in_file++;
733 }
734 mod_config.allow_omitted_members();
735 }
736 } else {
737 JsonObject mod_config = mod_config_json.get_object();
738 mark_visited( mod_config );
739 load_internal( mod_config, tileset_root, img_path, pump_events );
740 }
741 }
742
743 // loop through all tile ids and eliminate empty/invalid things
744 for( auto it = ts.tile_ids.begin(); it != ts.tile_ids.end(); ) {
745 // second is the tile_type describing that id
746 auto &td = it->second;
747 process_variations_after_loading( td.fg );
748 process_variations_after_loading( td.bg );
749 // All tiles need at least foreground or background data, otherwise they are useless.
750 if( td.bg.empty() && td.fg.empty() ) {
751 dbg( DL::Warn ) << "tile " << it->first << " has no (valid) foreground nor background";
752 ts.tile_ids.erase( it++ );
753 } else {
754 ++it;
755 }
756 }
757
758 if( !ts.find_tile_type( "unknown" ) ) {
759 dbg( DL::Warn ) << "The tileset you're using has no 'unknown' tile defined!";
760 }
761 ensure_default_item_highlight();
762
763 ts.tileset_id = tileset_id;
764}
765
766void tileset_loader::load_internal( const JsonObject &config, const std::string &tileset_root,
767 const std::string &img_path, const bool pump_events )
768{
769 if( config.has_array( "tiles-new" ) ) {
770 // new system, several entries
771 // When loading multiple tileset images this defines where
772 // the tiles from the most recently loaded image start from.
773 for( const JsonObject &tile_part_def : config.get_array( "tiles-new" ) ) {
774 const std::string tileset_image_path = tileset_root + '/' + tile_part_def.get_string( "file" );
775 R = -1;
776 G = -1;
777 B = -1;
778 if( tile_part_def.has_object( "transparency" ) ) {
779 JsonObject tra = tile_part_def.get_object( "transparency" );
780 R = tra.get_int( "R" );
781 G = tra.get_int( "G" );
782 B = tra.get_int( "B" );
783 }
784 sprite_width = tile_part_def.get_int( "sprite_width", ts.tile_width );
785 sprite_height = tile_part_def.get_int( "sprite_height", ts.tile_height );
786 // Now load the tile definitions for the loaded tileset image.
787 sprite_offset.x = tile_part_def.get_int( "sprite_offset_x", 0 );
788 sprite_offset.y = tile_part_def.get_int( "sprite_offset_y", 0 );
789 // First load the tileset image to get the number of available tiles.
790 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Attempting to Load Tileset file " << tileset_image_path;
791 load_tileset( tileset_image_path, pump_events );
792 load_tilejson_from_file( tile_part_def );
793 if( tile_part_def.has_member( "ascii" ) ) {
794 load_ascii( tile_part_def );
795 }
796 // Make sure the tile definitions of the next tileset image don't
797 // override the current ones.
798 offset += size;
799 if( pump_events ) {
800 inp_mngr.pump_events();
801 }
802 }
803 } else {
804 sprite_width = ts.tile_width;
805 sprite_height = ts.tile_height;
806 sprite_offset = point_zero;
807 R = -1;
808 G = -1;
809 B = -1;
810 // old system, no tile file path entry, only one array of tiles
811 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Attempting to Load Tileset file " << img_path;
812 load_tileset( img_path, pump_events );
813 load_tilejson_from_file( config );
814 offset = size;
815 }
816
817 // allows a tileset to override the order of mutation images being applied to a character
818 if( config.has_array( "overlay_ordering" ) ) {
819 load_overlay_ordering_into_array( config, tileset_mutation_overlay_ordering );
820 }
821
822 // offset should be the total number of sprites loaded from every tileset image
823 // eliminate any sprite references that are too high to exist
824 // also eliminate negative sprite references
825}
826
827void tileset_loader::process_variations_after_loading( weighted_int_list<std::vector<int>> &vs )
828{
829 // loop through all of the variations
830 for( auto &v : vs ) {
831 // in a given variation, erase any invalid sprite ids
832 v.obj.erase(
833 std::remove_if(
834 v.obj.begin(),
835 v.obj.end(),
836 [&]( int id ) {
837 return id >= offset || id < 0;
838 } ),
839 v.obj.end()
840 );
841 }
842 // erase any variations with no valid sprite ids left
843 vs.erase(
844 std::remove_if(
845 vs.begin(),
846 vs.end(),
847 [&]( weighted_object<int, std::vector<int>> o ) {
848 return o.obj.empty();
849 }
850 ),
851 vs.end()
852 );
853 // populate the bookkeeping table used for selecting sprite variations
854 vs.precalc();
855}
856
857void tileset_loader::add_ascii_subtile( tile_type &curr_tile, const std::string &t_id,
858 int sprite_id,
859 const std::string &s_id )
860{
861 const std::string m_id = t_id + "_" + s_id;
862 tile_type curr_subtile;
863 curr_subtile.fg.add( std::vector<int>( {sprite_id} ), 1 );
864 curr_subtile.rotates = true;
865 curr_tile.available_subtiles.push_back( s_id );
866 ts.create_tile_type( m_id, std::move( curr_subtile ) );
867}
868
869void tileset_loader::load_ascii( const JsonObject &config )
870{
871 if( !config.has_member( "ascii" ) ) {
872 config.throw_error( "\"ascii\" section missing" );
873 }
874 for( const JsonObject &entry : config.get_array( "ascii" ) ) {
875 load_ascii_set( entry );
876 }
877}
878
879void tileset_loader::load_ascii_set( const JsonObject &entry )
880{
881 // tile for ASCII char 0 is at `in_image_offset`,
882 // the other ASCII chars follow from there.
883 const int in_image_offset = entry.get_int( "offset" );
884 if( in_image_offset >= size ) {
885 entry.throw_error( "invalid offset (out of range)", "offset" );
886 }
887 // color, of the ASCII char. Can be -1 to indicate all/default colors.
888 int FG = -1;
889 const std::string scolor = entry.get_string( "color", "DEFAULT" );
890 if( scolor == "BLACK" ) {
891 FG = catacurses::black;
892 } else if( scolor == "RED" ) {
893 FG = catacurses::red;
894 } else if( scolor == "GREEN" ) {
895 FG = catacurses::green;
896 } else if( scolor == "YELLOW" ) {
897 FG = catacurses::yellow;
898 } else if( scolor == "BLUE" ) {
899 FG = catacurses::blue;
900 } else if( scolor == "MAGENTA" ) {
901 FG = catacurses::magenta;
902 } else if( scolor == "CYAN" ) {
903 FG = catacurses::cyan;
904 } else if( scolor == "WHITE" ) {
905 FG = catacurses::white;
906 } else if( scolor == "DEFAULT" ) {
907 FG = -1;
908 } else {
909 entry.throw_error( "invalid color for ASCII", "color" );
910 }
911 // Add an offset for bold colors (ncurses has this bold attribute,
912 // this mimics it). bold does not apply to default color.
913 if( FG != -1 && entry.get_bool( "bold", false ) ) {
914 FG += 8;
915 }
916 const int base_offset = offset + in_image_offset;
917 // Finally load all 256 ASCII chars (actually extended ASCII)
918 for( int ascii_char = 0; ascii_char < 256; ascii_char++ ) {
919 const int index_in_image = ascii_char + in_image_offset;
920 if( index_in_image < 0 || index_in_image >= size ) {
921 // Out of range is ignored for now.
922 continue;
923 }
924 const std::string id = get_ascii_tile_id( ascii_char, FG, -1 );
925 tile_type curr_tile;
926 curr_tile.offset = sprite_offset;
927 auto &sprites = *( curr_tile.fg.add( std::vector<int>( {index_in_image + offset} ), 1 ) );
928 switch( ascii_char ) {
929 // box bottom/top side (horizontal line)
930 case LINE_OXOX_C:
931 sprites[0] = 205 + base_offset;
932 break;
933 // box left/right side (vertical line)
934 case LINE_XOXO_C:
935 sprites[0] = 186 + base_offset;
936 break;
937 // box top left
938 case LINE_OXXO_C:
939 sprites[0] = 201 + base_offset;
940 break;
941 // box top right
942 case LINE_OOXX_C:
943 sprites[0] = 187 + base_offset;
944 break;
945 // box bottom right
946 case LINE_XOOX_C:
947 sprites[0] = 188 + base_offset;
948 break;
949 // box bottom left
950 case LINE_XXOO_C:
951 sprites[0] = 200 + base_offset;
952 break;
953 // box bottom north T (left, right, up)
954 case LINE_XXOX_C:
955 sprites[0] = 202 + base_offset;
956 break;
957 // box bottom east T (up, right, down)
958 case LINE_XXXO_C:
959 sprites[0] = 208 + base_offset;
960 break;
961 // box bottom south T (left, right, down)
962 case LINE_OXXX_C:
963 sprites[0] = 203 + base_offset;
964 break;
965 // box X (left down up right)
966 case LINE_XXXX_C:
967 sprites[0] = 206 + base_offset;
968 break;
969 // box bottom east T (left, down, up)
970 case LINE_XOXX_C:
971 sprites[0] = 184 + base_offset;
972 break;
973 }
974 if( ascii_char == LINE_XOXO_C || ascii_char == LINE_OXOX_C ) {
975 curr_tile.rotates = false;
976 curr_tile.multitile = true;
977 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 206 + base_offset, "center" );
978 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 201 + base_offset, "corner" );
979 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 186 + base_offset, "edge" );
980 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 203 + base_offset, "t_connection" );
981 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 210 + base_offset, "end_piece" );
982 add_ascii_subtile( curr_tile, id, 219 + base_offset, "unconnected" );
983 }
984 ts.create_tile_type( id, std::move( curr_tile ) );
985 }
986}
987
988void tileset_loader::load_tilejson_from_file( const JsonObject &config )
989{
990 if( !config.has_member( "tiles" ) ) {
991 config.throw_error( "\"tiles\" section missing" );
992 }
993
994 for( const JsonObject &entry : config.get_array( "tiles" ) ) {
995 std::vector<std::string> ids;
996 if( entry.has_string( "id" ) ) {
997 ids.push_back( entry.get_string( "id" ) );
998 } else if( entry.has_array( "id" ) ) {
999 ids = entry.get_string_array( "id" );
1000 }
1001 for( const std::string &t_id : ids ) {
1002 tile_type &curr_tile = load_tile( entry, t_id );
1003 curr_tile.offset = sprite_offset;
1004 bool t_multi = entry.get_bool( "multitile", false );
1005 bool t_rota = entry.get_bool( "rotates", t_multi );
1006 int t_h3d = entry.get_int( "height_3d", 0 );
1007 if( t_multi ) {
1008 // fetch additional tiles
1009 for( const JsonObject &subentry : entry.get_array( "additional_tiles" ) ) {
1010 const std::string s_id = subentry.get_string( "id" );
1011 const std::string m_id = t_id + "_" + s_id;
1012 tile_type &curr_subtile = load_tile( subentry, m_id );
1013 curr_subtile.offset = sprite_offset;
1014 curr_subtile.rotates = true;
1015 curr_subtile.height_3d = t_h3d;
1016 curr_subtile.animated = subentry.get_bool( "animated", false );
1017 curr_tile.available_subtiles.push_back( s_id );
1018 }
1019 } else if( entry.has_array( "additional_tiles" ) ) {
1020 entry.throw_error( "Additional tiles defined, but 'multitile' is not true." );
1021 }
1022 // write the information of the base tile to curr_tile
1023 curr_tile.multitile = t_multi;
1024 curr_tile.rotates = t_rota;
1025 curr_tile.height_3d = t_h3d;
1026 curr_tile.animated = entry.get_bool( "animated", false );
1027 }
1028 }
1029 dbg( DL::Info ) << "Tile Width: " << ts.tile_width << " Tile Height: " << ts.tile_height <<
1030 " Tile Definitions: " << ts.tile_ids.size();
1031}
1032
1033/**
1034 * Load a tile definition and add it to the @ref tileset::tile_ids map.
1035 * All loaded tiles go into one vector (@ref tileset::tile_values), their index in it is their id.
1036 * The JSON data (loaded here) contains tile ids relative to the associated image.
1037 * They are translated into global ids by adding the @p offset, which is the number of
1038 * previously loaded tiles (excluding the tiles from the associated image).
1039 * @param id The id of the new tile definition (which is the key in @ref tileset::tile_ids). Any existing
1040 * definition of the same id is overridden.
1041 * @return A reference to the loaded tile inside the @ref tileset::tile_ids map.
1042 */
1043tile_type &tileset_loader::load_tile( const JsonObject &entry, const std::string &id )
1044{
1045 tile_type curr_subtile;
1046
1047 load_tile_spritelists( entry, curr_subtile.fg, "fg" );
1048 load_tile_spritelists( entry, curr_subtile.bg, "bg" );
1049
1050 return ts.create_tile_type( id, std::move( curr_subtile ) );
1051}
1052
1053void tileset_loader::load_tile_spritelists( const JsonObject &entry,
1054 weighted_int_list<std::vector<int>> &vs,
1055 const std::string &objname )
1056{
1057 // json array indicates rotations or variations
1058 if( entry.has_array( objname ) ) {
1059 JsonArray g_array = entry.get_array( objname );
1060 // int elements of array indicates rotations
1061 // create one variation, populate sprite_ids with list of ints
1062 if( g_array.test_int() ) {
1063 std::vector<int> v;
1064 for( const int entry : g_array ) {
1065 const int sprite_id = entry + sprite_id_offset;
1066 if( sprite_id >= 0 ) {
1067 v.push_back( sprite_id );
1068 }
1069 }
1070 vs.add( v, 1 );
1071 }
1072 // object elements of array indicates variations
1073 // create one variation per object
1074 else if( g_array.test_object() ) {
1075 for( const JsonObject &vo : g_array ) {
1076 std::vector<int> v;
1077 int weight = vo.get_int( "weight" );
1078 // negative weight is invalid
1079 if( weight < 0 ) {
1080 vo.throw_error( "Invalid weight for sprite variation (<0)", objname );
1081 }
1082 // int sprite means one sprite
1083 if( vo.has_int( "sprite" ) ) {
1084 const int sprite_id = vo.get_int( "sprite" ) + sprite_id_offset;
1085 if( sprite_id >= 0 ) {
1086 v.push_back( sprite_id );
1087 }
1088 }
1089 // array sprite means rotations
1090 else if( vo.has_array( "sprite" ) ) {
1091 for( const int entry : vo.get_array( "sprite" ) ) {
1092 const int sprite_id = entry + sprite_id_offset;
1093 if( sprite_id >= 0 ) {
1094 v.push_back( sprite_id );
1095 }
1096 }
1097 }
1098 if( v.size() != 1 &&
1099 v.size() != 2 &&
1100 v.size() != 4 ) {
1101 vo.throw_error( "Invalid number of sprites (not 1, 2, or 4)", objname );
1102 }
1103 vs.add( v, weight );
1104 }
1105 }
1106 }
1107 // json int indicates a single sprite id
1108 else if( entry.has_int( objname ) && entry.get_int( objname ) >= 0 ) {
1109 vs.add( std::vector<int>( {entry.get_int( objname ) + sprite_id_offset} ), 1 );
1110 }
1111}
1112
1113static int divide_round_down( int a, int b )
1114{
1115 if( b < 0 ) {
1116 a = -a;
1117 b = -b;
1118 }
1119 if( a >= 0 ) {
1120 return a / b;
1121 } else {
1122 return -( ( -a + b - 1 ) / b );
1123 }
1124}
1125
1126void cata_tiles::draw( const point &dest, const tripoint &center, int width, int height,
1127 std::multimap<point, formatted_text> &overlay_strings,
1128 color_block_overlay_container &color_blocks )
1129{
1130 if( !g ) {
1131 return;
1132 }
1133
1134#if defined(__ANDROID__)
1135 // Attempted bugfix for Google Play crash - prevent divide-by-zero if no tile width/height specified
1136 if( tile_width == 0 || tile_height == 0 ) {
1137 return;
1138 }
1139#endif
1140
1141 {
1142 //set clipping to prevent drawing over stuff we shouldn't
1143 SDL_Rect clipRect = {dest.x, dest.y, width, height};
1144 printErrorIf( SDL_RenderSetClipRect( renderer.get(), &clipRect ) != 0,
1145 "SDL_RenderSetClipRect failed" );
1146
1147 //fill render area with black to prevent artifacts where no new pixels are drawn
1148 geometry->rect( renderer, clipRect, SDL_Color() );
1149 }
1150
1151 point s;
1152 get_window_tile_counts( width, height, s.x, s.y );
1153
1154 init_light();
1155 map &here = get_map();
1156 const visibility_variables &cache = here.get_visibility_variables_cache();
1157
1158 const bool iso_mode = tile_iso;
1159
1160 o = iso_mode ? center.xy() : center.xy() - point( POSX, POSY );
1161
1162 op = dest;
1163 // Rounding up to include incomplete tiles at the bottom/right edges
1164 screentile_width = divide_round_up( width, tile_width );
1165 screentile_height = divide_round_up( height, tile_height );
1166
1167 const int min_col = 0;
1168 const int max_col = s.x;
1169 const int min_row = 0;
1170 const int max_row = s.y;
1171
1172 //limit the render area to maximum view range (121x121 square centered on player)
1173 const int min_visible_x = g->u.posx() % SEEX;
1174 const int min_visible_y = g->u.posy() % SEEY;
1175 const int max_visible_x = ( g->u.posx() % SEEX ) + ( MAPSIZE - 1 ) * SEEX;
1176 const int max_visible_y = ( g->u.posy() % SEEY ) + ( MAPSIZE - 1 ) * SEEY;
1177
1178 // Map memory should be at least the size of the view range
1179 // so that new tiles can be memorized, and at least the size of the display
1180 // since at farthest zoom displayed area may be bigger than view range.
1181 const point min_mm_reg = point(
1182 std::min( o.x, min_visible_x ),
1183 std::min( o.y, min_visible_y )
1184 );
1185 const point max_mm_reg = point(
1186 std::max( s.x + o.x, max_visible_x ),
1187 std::max( s.y + o.y, max_visible_y )
1188 );
1189 g->u.prepare_map_memory_region(
1190 here.getabs( tripoint( min_mm_reg, center.z ) ),
1191 here.getabs( tripoint( max_mm_reg, center.z ) )
1192 );
1193
1194 idle_animations.set_enabled( get_option<bool>( "ANIMATIONS" ) );
1195 idle_animations.prepare_for_redraw();
1196
1197 //set up a default tile for the edges outside the render area
1198 visibility_type offscreen_type = VIS_DARK;
1199 if( cache.u_is_boomered ) {
1200 offscreen_type = VIS_BOOMER_DARK;
1201 }
1202
1203 //retrieve night vision goggle status once per draw
1204 auto vision_cache = g->u.get_vision_modes();
1205 nv_goggles_activated = vision_cache[NV_GOGGLES];
1206
1207 // check that the creature for which we'll draw the visibility map is still alive at that point
1208 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_VISIBILITY ) && g->displaying_visibility_creature ) {
1209 const Creature *creature = g->displaying_visibility_creature;
1210 const auto is_same_creature_predicate = [&creature]( const Creature & c ) {
1211 return creature == &c;
1212 };
1213 if( g->get_creature_if( is_same_creature_predicate ) == nullptr ) {
1214 g->displaying_visibility_creature = nullptr;
1215 }
1216 }
1217 const point half_tile( tile_width / 2, 0 );
1218 const point quarter_tile( tile_width / 4, tile_height / 4 );
1219 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_VEHICLE_AI ) ) {
1220 for( const wrapped_vehicle &elem : here.get_vehicles() ) {
1221 const vehicle &veh = *elem.v;
1222 const point veh_pos = veh.global_pos3().xy();
1223 for( const auto &overlay_data : veh.get_debug_overlay_data() ) {
1224 const point pt = veh_pos + std::get<0>( overlay_data );
1225 const int color = std::get<1>( overlay_data );
1226 const std::string &text = std::get<2>( overlay_data );
1227 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( pt ),
1228 formatted_text( text, color,
1229 text_alignment::left ) );
1230 }
1231 }
1232 }
1233
1234 std::vector<tile_render_info> &draw_points = *draw_points_cache;
1235 int min_z = OVERMAP_HEIGHT;
1236
1237 for( int row = min_row; row < max_row; row ++ ) {
1238
1239 draw_points.clear();
1240 for( int col = min_col; col < max_col; col ++ ) {
1241 int temp_x;
1242 int temp_y;
1243 if( iso_mode ) {
1244 //in isometric, rows and columns represent a checkerboard screen space, and we place
1245 //the appropriate tile in valid squares by getting position relative to the screen center.
1246 if( modulo( row - s.y / 2, 2 ) != modulo( col - s.x / 2, 2 ) ) {
1247 continue;
1248 }
1249 temp_x = divide_round_down( col - row - s.x / 2 + s.y / 2, 2 ) + o.x;
1250 temp_y = divide_round_down( row + col - s.y / 2 - s.x / 2, 2 ) + o.y;
1251 } else {
1252 temp_x = col + o.x;
1253 temp_y = row + o.y;
1254 }
1255
1256 bool invis = ( temp_y < min_visible_y || temp_y > max_visible_y || temp_x < min_visible_x ||
1257 temp_x > max_visible_x ) &&
1258 ( has_memory_at( {temp_x, temp_y, center.z} ) || has_draw_override( {temp_x, temp_y, center.z} ) );
1259
1260
1261
1262 // Add scent value to the overlay_strings list for every visible tile when displaying scent
1263 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_SCENT ) && !invis ) {
1264 const int scent_value = g->scent.get( {temp_x, temp_y, center.z} );
1265 if( scent_value > 0 ) {
1266 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( point( temp_x, temp_y ) ) + point( tile_width / 2, 0 ),
1267 formatted_text( std::to_string( scent_value ), 8 + catacurses::yellow,
1268 direction::NORTH ) );
1269 }
1270 }
1271
1272 // Add scent type to the overlay_strings list for every visible tile when displaying scent
1273 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_SCENT_TYPE ) && !invis ) {
1274 const scenttype_id scent_type = g->scent.get_type( {temp_x, temp_y, center.z} );
1275 if( !scent_type.is_empty() ) {
1276 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( point( temp_x, temp_y ) ) + point( tile_width / 2, 0 ),
1277 formatted_text( scent_type.c_str(), 8 + catacurses::yellow,
1278 direction::NORTH ) );
1279 }
1280 }
1281
1282 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_RADIATION ) ) {
1283 const auto rad_override = radiation_override.find( {temp_x, temp_y, center.z} );
1284 const bool rad_overridden = rad_override != radiation_override.end();
1285 if( rad_overridden || !invis ) {
1286 const int rad_value = rad_overridden ? rad_override->second : here.get_radiation( {temp_x, temp_y, center.z} );
1287 catacurses::base_color col;
1288 if( rad_value > 0 ) {
1289 col = catacurses::green;
1290 } else {
1291 col = catacurses::cyan;
1292 }
1293 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( point( temp_x, temp_y ) ) + point( tile_width / 2, 0 ),
1294 formatted_text( std::to_string( rad_value ), 8 + col, direction::NORTH ) );
1295 }
1296 }
1297
1298 // Add temperature value to the overlay_strings list for every visible tile when displaying temperature
1299 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_TEMPERATURE ) && !invis ) {
1300 int temp_value = get_weather().get_temperature( {temp_x, temp_y, center.z} );
1301 int ctemp = units::fahrenheit_to_celsius( temp_value );
1302 short color;
1303 const short bold = 8;
1304 if( ctemp > 40 ) {
1305 color = catacurses::red;
1306 } else if( ctemp > 25 ) {
1307 color = catacurses::yellow + bold;
1308 } else if( ctemp > 10 ) {
1309 color = catacurses::green + bold;
1310 } else if( ctemp > 0 ) {
1311 color = catacurses::white + bold;
1312 } else if( ctemp > -10 ) {
1313 color = catacurses::cyan + bold;
1314 } else {
1315 color = catacurses::blue + bold;
1316 }
1317 if( get_option<std::string>( "USE_CELSIUS" ) == "celsius" ) {
1318 temp_value = units::fahrenheit_to_celsius( temp_value );
1319 } else if( get_option<std::string>( "USE_CELSIUS" ) == "kelvin" ) {
1320 temp_value = units::fahrenheit_to_kelvin( temp_value );
1321
1322 }
1323 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( point( temp_x, temp_y ) ) + point( tile_width / 2, 0 ),
1324 formatted_text( std::to_string( temp_value ), color,
1325 direction::NORTH ) );
1326 }
1327
1328 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_VISIBILITY ) &&
1329 g->displaying_visibility_creature && !invis ) {
1330 const bool visibility = g->displaying_visibility_creature->sees( {temp_x, temp_y, center.z} );
1331
1332 // color overlay.
1333 auto block_color = visibility ? windowsPalette[catacurses::green] : SDL_Color{ 192, 192, 192, 255 };
1334 block_color.a = 100;
1335 color_blocks.first = SDL_BLENDMODE_BLEND;
1336 color_blocks.second.emplace( player_to_screen( point( temp_x, temp_y ) ), block_color );
1337
1338 // overlay string
1339 std::string visibility_str = visibility ? "+" : "-";
1340 overlay_strings.emplace(
1341 player_to_screen( point( temp_x, temp_y ) ) + point( tile_width / 4, tile_height / 4 ),
1342 formatted_text( visibility_str, catacurses::black, direction::NORTH ) );
1343 }
1344
1345 static std::vector<SDL_Color> lighting_colors;
1346 // color hue in the range of [0..10], 0 being white, 10 being blue
1347 auto draw_debug_tile = [&]( const int color_hue, const std::string & text ) {
1348 if( lighting_colors.empty() ) {
1349 SDL_Color white = { 255, 255, 255, 255 };
1350 SDL_Color blue = { 0, 0, 255, 255 };
1351 lighting_colors = color_linear_interpolate( white, blue, 9 );
1352 }
1353 point tile_pos = player_to_screen( point( temp_x, temp_y ) );
1354
1355 // color overlay
1356 SDL_Color color = lighting_colors[std::min( std::max( 0, color_hue ), 10 )];
1357 color.a = 100;
1358 color_blocks.first = SDL_BLENDMODE_BLEND;
1359 color_blocks.second.emplace( tile_pos, color );
1360
1361 // string overlay
1362 overlay_strings.emplace( tile_pos + quarter_tile, formatted_text( text, catacurses::black,
1363 direction::NORTH ) );
1364 };
1365
1366 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_LIGHTING ) ) {
1367 if( g->displaying_lighting_condition == 0 ) {
1368 const float light = here.ambient_light_at( {temp_x, temp_y, center.z} );
1369 // note: lighting will be constrained in the [1.0, 11.0] range.
1370 int intensity = static_cast<int>( std::max( 1.0, LIGHT_AMBIENT_LIT - light + 1.0 ) ) - 1;
1371 draw_debug_tile( intensity, string_format( "%.1f", light ) );
1372 }
1373 }
1374
1375 if( g->display_overlay_state( ACTION_DISPLAY_TRANSPARENCY ) ) {
1376 const float tr = here.light_transparency( {temp_x, temp_y, center.z} );
1377 int intensity = tr <= LIGHT_TRANSPARENCY_SOLID ? 10 : static_cast<int>
1378 ( ( tr - LIGHT_TRANSPARENCY_OPEN_AIR ) * 8 );
1379 draw_debug_tile( intensity, string_format( "%.2f", tr ) );
1380 }
1381
1382 lit_level ll = lit_level::BLANK;
1383 int last_vis = center.z + 1;
1384 for( int z = center.z; z >= -OVERMAP_DEPTH; z-- ) {
1385 const auto &ch = here.access_cache( z );
1386
1387 const tripoint pos( temp_x, temp_y, z );
1388 const int &x = pos.x;
1389 const int &y = pos.y;
1390
1391 bool in_vis_bounds = ( y >= min_visible_y && y <= max_visible_y && x >= min_visible_x &&
1392 x <= max_visible_x );
1393
1394 bool in_map_bounds = here.inbounds( pos );
1395
1396 if( ( fov_3d || z == center.z ) && in_map_bounds ) {
1397 ll = ch.visibility_cache[x][y];
1398 if( !would_apply_vision_effects( here.get_visibility( ch.visibility_cache[x][y], cache ) ) ) {
1399 last_vis = z;
1400 }
1401 }
1402
1403 const auto low_override = draw_below_override.find( pos );
1404 const bool low_overridden = low_override != draw_below_override.end();
1405 if( low_overridden ? !low_override->second :
1406 ( in_map_bounds && ( here.dont_draw_lower_floor( pos ) || has_memory_at( pos ) ) )
1407 || ( !in_map_bounds && ( has_memory_at( pos ) || pos.z <= 0 ) ) ) {
1408 // invisible to normal eyes
1409 bool invisible[5];
1410 invisible[0] = false;
1411
1412 if( !in_vis_bounds ) {
1413 if( has_memory_at( pos ) ) {
1414 ll = lit_level::MEMORIZED;
1415 invisible[0] = true;
1416 } else if( has_draw_override( pos ) ) {
1417 ll = lit_level::DARK;
1418 invisible[0] = true;
1419 } else {
1420 apply_vision_effects( pos, offscreen_type );
1421 break;
1422 }
1423 }
1424
1425 int height_3d = 0;
1426
1427 for( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
1428 const tripoint np = pos + neighborhood[i];
1429 invisible[1 + i] = np.y < min_visible_y || np.y > max_visible_y ||
1430 np.x < min_visible_x || np.x > max_visible_x ||
1431 would_apply_vision_effects( here.get_visibility( ch.visibility_cache[np.x][np.y], cache ) );
1432 }
1433
1434 if( !invisible[0] && apply_vision_effects( pos, here.get_visibility( ll, cache ) ) ) {
1435 if( has_draw_override( pos ) || has_memory_at( pos ) ) {
1436 invisible[0] = true;
1437 }
1438 for( int cz = pos.z; !invisible[0] && cz <= -center.z; cz++ ) {
1439 const Creature *critter = g->critter_at( {pos.xy(), cz}, true );
1440 if( critter && ( g->u.sees_with_infrared( *critter ) ||
1441 g->u.sees_with_specials( *critter ) ) ) {
1442 invisible[0] = true;
1443 }
1444 }
1445 if( invisible[0] ) {
1446 min_z = std::min( pos.z, min_z );
1447 draw_points.emplace_back( pos, height_3d, ll, invisible );
1448 } else if( last_vis != center.z + 1 ) {
1449 min_z = std::min( last_vis, min_z );
1450 draw_points.emplace_back( tripoint( pos.xy(), last_vis ), height_3d, ll, invisible );
1451 }
1452
1453 } else {
1454 min_z = std::min( pos.z, min_z );
1455 draw_points.emplace_back( pos, height_3d, ll, invisible );
1456 }
1457 break;
1458 }
1459 }
1460 }
1461
1462 auto compare_z = [&]( tile_render_info a, tile_render_info b ) -> bool {
1463 return ( a.pos.z < b.pos.z );
1464 };
1465
1466 const std::array<decltype( &cata_tiles::draw_furniture ), 3> base_drawing_layers = {{
1467 &cata_tiles::draw_furniture, &cata_tiles::draw_graffiti, &cata_tiles::draw_trap
1468 }
1469 };
1470 struct zlevel_layer {
1471 bool hide_unseen;
1472 decltype( &cata_tiles::draw_furniture ) function;
1473 };
1474 const std::array < zlevel_layer, 3 > zlevel_drawing_layers = {{
1475 {true, &cata_tiles::draw_field_or_item}, {false, &cata_tiles::draw_vpart}, {true, &cata_tiles::draw_critter_at}
1476 }
1477 };
1478
1479 const std::array<decltype( &cata_tiles::draw_furniture ), 2> final_drawing_layers = {{
1480 &cata_tiles::draw_zone_mark, &cata_tiles::draw_zombie_revival_indicators
1481 }
1482 };
1483
1484 std::stable_sort( draw_points.begin(), draw_points.end(), compare_z );
1485 for( tile_render_info &p : draw_points ) {
1486 draw_terrain( p.pos, p.ll, p.height_3d, p.invisible, center.z - p.pos.z );
1487 }
1488
1489 for( int z = min_z; z <= center.z; z++ ) {
1490 for( tile_render_info &p : draw_points ) {
1491 if( p.pos.z > z ) {
1492 break;
1493 }
1494 if( p.pos.z == z ) {
1495 for( decltype( &cata_tiles::draw_furniture ) f : base_drawing_layers ) {
1496 ( this->*f )( p.pos, p.ll, p.height_3d, p.invisible, center.z - p.pos.z );
1497 }
1498 }
1499 const auto &ch = here.access_cache( z );
1500
1501 for( const zlevel_layer &f : zlevel_drawing_layers ) {
1502 if( here.inbounds( p.pos ) && z != p.pos.z ) {
1503 if( !f.hide_unseen || ch.visibility_cache[p.pos.x][p.pos.y] != lit_level::BLANK ) {
1504 const bool ( invis )[5] = {false, false, false, false, false};
1505 ( this->*( f.function ) )( {p.pos.xy(), z}, p.ll, p.height_3d, invis, center.z - z );
1506 }
1507 } else {
1508 ( this->*( f.function ) )( {p.pos.xy(), z}, p.ll, p.height_3d, p.invisible, center.z - z );
1509 }
1510 }
1511 }
1512 }
1513
1514 for( tile_render_info &p : draw_points ) {
1515 for( decltype( &cata_tiles::draw_furniture ) f : final_drawing_layers ) {
1516 ( this->*f )( p.pos, p.ll, p.height_3d, p.invisible, 0 );
1517 }
1518 }
1519 }
1520
1521 // display number of monsters to spawn in mapgen preview
1522 for( const tile_render_info &p : draw_points ) {
1523 const auto mon_override = monster_override.find( p.pos );
1524 if( mon_override != monster_override.end() ) {
1525 const int count = std::get<1>( mon_override->second );
1526 const bool more = std::get<2>( mon_override->second );
1527 if( count > 1 || more ) {
1528 std::string text = "x" + std::to_string( count );
1529 if( more ) {
1530 text += "+";
1531 }
1532 overlay_strings.emplace( player_to_screen( p.pos.xy() ) + point( tile_width / 2, 0 ),
1533 formatted_text( text, catacurses::red, direction::NORTH ) );
1534 }
1535 }
1536 }
1537 // tile overrides are already drawn in the previous code
1538 void_radiation_override();
1539 void_terrain_override();
1540 void_furniture_override();
1541 void_graffiti_override();
1542 void_trap_override();
1543 void_field_override();
1544 void_item_override();
1545 void_vpart_override();
1546 void_draw_below_override();
1547 void_monster_override();
1548
1549 //Memorize everything the character just saw even if it wasn't displayed.
1550 for( int mem_y = min_visible_y; mem_y <= max_visible_y; mem_y++ ) {
1551 for( int mem_x = min_visible_x; mem_x <= max_visible_x; mem_x++ ) {
1552 half_open_rectangle<point> already_drawn(
1553 point( min_col, min_row ), point( max_col, max_row ) );
1554 if( iso_mode ) {
1555 // calculate the screen position according to the drawing code above (division rounded down):
1556
1557 // mem_x = ( col - row - sx / 2 + sy / 2 ) / 2 + o.x;
1558 // mem_y = ( row + col - sy / 2 - sx / 2 ) / 2 + o.y;
1559 // ( col - sx / 2 ) % 2 = ( row - sy / 2 ) % 2
1560 // ||
1561 // \/
1562 const int col = mem_y + mem_x + s.x / 2 - o.y - o.x;
1563 const int row = mem_y - mem_x + s.y / 2 - o.y + o.x;
1564 if( already_drawn.contains( point( col, row ) ) ) {
1565 continue;
1566 }
1567 } else {
1568 // calculate the screen position according to the drawing code above:
1569
1570 // mem_x = col + o.x
1571 // mem_y = row + o.y
1572 // ||
1573 // \/
1574 // col = mem_x - o.x
1575 // row = mem_y - o.y
1576 if( already_drawn.contains( point( mem_x, mem_y ) - o ) ) {
1577 continue;
1578 }
1579 }
1580
1581 lit_level lighting = here.access_cache( center.z ).visibility_cache[mem_x][mem_y];
1582
1583 int z = center.z;
1584 for( ; z > -OVERMAP_DEPTH; z-- ) {
1585 const auto low_override = draw_below_override.find( {mem_x, mem_y, z} );
1586 const bool low_overridden = low_override != draw_below_override.end();
1587 if( low_overridden ? !low_override->second : ( here.dont_draw_lower_floor( {mem_x, mem_y, z} )
1588 || ( fov_3d && lighting != lit_level::BLANK &&
1589 here.access_cache( z - 1 ).visibility_cache[mem_x][mem_y] == lit_level::BLANK ) ) ) {
1590 if( fov_3d ) {
1591 lighting = here.access_cache( z ).visibility_cache[mem_x][mem_y];
1592 }
1593 break;
1594 }
1595 }
1596
1597
1598 const auto &ch = here.access_cache( z );
1599 const tripoint p( mem_x, mem_y, z );
1600
1601 if( apply_vision_effects( p, here.get_visibility( lighting, cache ) ) ) {
1602 continue;
1603 }
1604 int height_3d = 0;
1605 bool invisible[5];
1606 invisible[0] = false;
1607 for( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
1608 const tripoint np = p + neighborhood[i];
1609 invisible[1 + i] = np.y < min_visible_y || np.y > max_visible_y ||
1610 np.x < min_visible_x || np.x > max_visible_x ||
1611 would_apply_vision_effects( here.get_visibility( ch.visibility_cache[np.x][np.y], cache ) );
1612 }
1613 //calling draw to memorize everything.
1614 //bypass cache check in case we learn something new about the terrain's connections
1615 draw_terrain( p, lighting, height_3d, invisible, 0 );
1616 if( here.check_seen_cache( p ) ) {
1617 draw_furniture( p, lighting, height_3d, invisible, 0 );
1618 draw_trap( p, lighting, height_3d, invisible, 0 );
1619 draw_vpart( p, lighting, height_3d, invisible, 0 );
1620 here.check_and_set_seen_cache( p );
1621 }
1622 }
1623 }
1624
1625 in_animation = do_draw_explosion || do_draw_custom_explosion ||
1626 do_draw_bullet || do_draw_hit || do_draw_line ||
1627 do_draw_cursor || do_draw_highlight || do_draw_weather ||
1628 do_draw_sct || do_draw_zones || do_draw_cone_aoe;
1629
1630 draw_footsteps_frame( center );
1631 if( in_animation ) {
1632 if( do_draw_explosion ) {
1633 draw_explosion_frame();
1634 }
1635 if( do_draw_custom_explosion ) {
1636 draw_custom_explosion_frame();
1637 }
1638 if( do_draw_bullet ) {
1639 draw_bullet_frame();
1640 }
1641 if( do_draw_hit ) {
1642 draw_hit_frame();
1643 void_hit();
1644 }
1645 if( do_draw_line ) {
1646 draw_line();
1647 void_line();
1648 }
1649 if( do_draw_weather ) {
1650 draw_weather_frame();
1651 void_weather();
1652 }
1653 if( do_draw_sct ) {
1654 draw_sct_frame( overlay_strings );
1655 void_sct();
1656 }
1657 if( do_draw_zones ) {
1658 draw_zones_frame();
1659 void_zones();
1660 }
1661 if( do_draw_cursor ) {
1662 draw_cursor();
1663 void_cursor();
1664 }
1665 if( do_draw_highlight ) {
1666 draw_highlight();
1667 void_highlight();
1668 }
1669 if( do_draw_cone_aoe ) {
1670 draw_cone_aoe_frame();
1671 }
1672 } else if( g->u.view_offset != tripoint_zero && !g->u.in_vehicle ) {
1673 // check to see if player is located at ter
1674 draw_from_id_string( "cursor", C_NONE, empty_string,
1675 tripoint( g->ter_view_p.xy(), center.z ), 0, 0, lit_level::LIT,
1676 false, 0 );
1677 }
1678 if( g->u.controlling_vehicle ) {
1679 if( cata::optional<tripoint> indicator_offset = g->get_veh_dir_indicator_location( true ) ) {
1680 draw_from_id_string( "cursor", C_NONE, empty_string, indicator_offset->xy() + tripoint( g->u.posx(),
1681 g->u.posy(), center.z ),
1682 0, 0, lit_level::LIT, false, 0 );
1683 }
1684 }
1685
1686 if( g->debug_submap_grid_overlay && !iso_mode ) {
1687 point sm_start = ms_to_sm_copy( here.getabs( point( min_col, min_row ) + o ) );
1688 point sm_end = ms_to_sm_copy( here.getabs( point( max_col, max_row ) + o ) );
1689
1690 bool zlevs = here.has_zlevels();
1691 int mapsize = here.getmapsize();
1692 tripoint mappos = here.get_abs_sub();
1693 half_open_rectangle<point> maprect( mappos.xy(), mappos.xy() + point( mapsize, mapsize ) );
1694
1695 const auto is_map = [mappos, zlevs, maprect]( const tripoint & p ) {
1696 if( !maprect.contains( p.xy() ) ) {
1697 return false;
1698 }
1699 if( zlevs ) {
1700 return true;
1701 } else {
1702 return p.z == mappos.z;
1703 }
1704 };
1705
1706 const auto is_mapbuffer = []( const tripoint & p ) {
1707 return MAPBUFFER.is_submap_loaded( p );
1708 };
1709
1710 constexpr int THICC = 1; // line thickness
1711 for( int sm_x = sm_start.x; sm_x <= sm_end.x; sm_x++ ) {
1712 for( int sm_y = sm_start.y; sm_y <= sm_end.y; sm_y++ ) {
1713 point sm_p = point( sm_x, sm_y );
1714 tripoint sm_tp = tripoint( sm_x, sm_y, center.z );
1715 point p1 = player_to_screen( here.getlocal( sm_to_ms_copy( sm_p ) ) );
1716 point p3 = player_to_screen( here.getlocal( sm_to_ms_copy( sm_p + point_south_east ) ) );
1717 p3 -= point( THICC, THICC ); // Don't draw over other lines
1718
1719 // Leave a small gap to indicate omt boundaries
1720 point tmp = omt_to_sm_copy( sm_to_omt_copy( sm_tp ) ).xy();
1721 if( tmp.x == sm_tp.x ) {
1722 p1.x += 2;
1723 }
1724 if( tmp.y == sm_tp.y ) {
1725 p1.y += 2;
1726 }
1727
1728 SDL_Color col;
1729 if( is_map( sm_tp ) ) {
1730 col = {0, 220, 0, 255};
1731 } else if( is_mapbuffer( sm_tp ) ) {
1732 col = {0, 180, 180, 255};
1733 } else {
1734 col = {0, 0, 220, 255};
1735 }
1736
1737 geometry->vertical_line( renderer, p1, p3.y, THICC, col );
1738 geometry->vertical_line( renderer, point( p3.x, p1.y ), p3.y, THICC, col );
1739 geometry->horizontal_line( renderer, p1, p3.x, THICC, col );
1740 geometry->horizontal_line( renderer, point( p1.x, p3.y ), p3.x, THICC, col );
1741 }
1742 }
1743 }
1744
1745 printErrorIf( SDL_RenderSetClipRect( renderer.get(), nullptr ) != 0,
1746 "SDL_RenderSetClipRect failed" );
1747}
1748
1749bool cata_tiles::terrain_requires_animation() const
1750{
1751 return idle_animations.enabled() && idle_animations.present();
1752}
1753
1754void cata_tiles::draw_minimap( const point &dest, const tripoint &center, int width, int height )
1755{
1756 minimap->draw( SDL_Rect{ dest.x, dest.y, width, height }, center );
1757}
1758
1759bool cata_tiles::minimap_requires_animation() const
1760{
1761 return minimap->has_animated_elements();
1762}
1763
1764void cata_tiles::get_window_tile_counts( const int width, const int height, int &columns,
1765 int &rows ) const
1766{
1767 if( tile_iso ) {
1768 columns = std::ceil( static_cast<double>( width ) / tile_width ) * 2 + 4;
1769 rows = std::ceil( static_cast<double>( height ) / ( tile_width / 2.0 - 1 ) ) * 2 + 4;
1770 } else {
1771 columns = std::ceil( static_cast<double>( width ) / tile_width );
1772 rows = std::ceil( static_cast<double>( height ) / tile_height );
1773 }
1774}
