1800cata::optional<tile_lookup_res>
1801cata_tiles::find_tile_with_season( const std::string &id ) const
1802{
1803 const season_type season = season_of_year( calendar::turn );
1804 return tileset_ptr->find_tile_type_by_season( id, season );
1805}
1806
1807template<typename T>
1808cata::optional<tile_lookup_res>
1809cata_tiles::find_tile_looks_like_by_string_id( const std::string &id, TILE_CATEGORY category,
1810 const int looks_like_jumps_limit ) const
1811{
1812 const string_id<T> s_id( id );
1813 if( !s_id.is_valid() ) {
1814 return cata::nullopt;
1815 }
1816 const T &obj = s_id.obj();
1817 return find_tile_looks_like( obj.looks_like, category, looks_like_jumps_limit - 1 );
1818}
1819
1820cata::optional<tile_lookup_res>
1821cata_tiles::find_tile_looks_like( const std::string &id, TILE_CATEGORY category,
1822 const int looks_like_jumps_limit ) const
1823{
1824 if( id.empty() || looks_like_jumps_limit <= 0 ) {
1825 return cata::nullopt;
1826 }
1827
1828 // Note on memory management:
1829 // This method must returns pointers to the objects (std::string *id and tile_type * tile)
1830 // that are valid when this metod returns. Ideally they should have the lifetime
1831 // that is equal or exceeds lifetime of `this` or `this::tileset_ptr`.
1832 // For example, `id` argument may have shorter lifetime and thus should not be returned!
1833 // The result of `find_tile_with_season` is OK to be returned, because it's guaranteed to
1834 // return pointers to the keys and values that are stored inside the `tileset_ptr`.
1835 const auto tile_with_season = find_tile_with_season( id );
1836 if( tile_with_season ) {
1837 return tile_with_season;
1838 }
1839
1840 switch( category ) {
1841 case C_FURNITURE:
1842 return find_tile_looks_like_by_string_id<furn_t>( id, category, looks_like_jumps_limit );
1843 case C_TERRAIN:
1844 return find_tile_looks_like_by_string_id<ter_t>( id, category, looks_like_jumps_limit );
1845 case C_FIELD:
1846 return find_tile_looks_like_by_string_id<field_type>( id, category, looks_like_jumps_limit );
1847 case C_MONSTER:
1848 return find_tile_looks_like_by_string_id<mtype>( id, category, looks_like_jumps_limit );
1849 case C_OVERMAP_TERRAIN: {
1850 cata::optional<tile_lookup_res> ret;
1851 const oter_type_str_id type_tmp( id );
1852 if( !type_tmp.is_valid() ) {
1853 return ret;
1854 }
1855
1856 int jump_limit = looks_like_jumps_limit;
1857 for( const std::string &looks_like : type_tmp.obj().looks_like ) {
1858
1859 ret = find_tile_looks_like( looks_like, category, jump_limit - 1 );
1860 if( ret.has_value() ) {
1861 return ret;
1862 }
1863
1864 jump_limit--;
1865 if( jump_limit <= 0 ) {
1866 return ret;
1867 }
1868 }
1869
1870 return ret;
1871 }
1872
1873 case C_VEHICLE_PART: {
1874 // vehicle parts start with vp_ for their tiles, but not their IDs
1875 const vpart_id base_vpid( id.substr( 3 ) );
1876 if( !base_vpid.is_valid() ) {
1877 return cata::nullopt;
1878 }
1879 return find_tile_looks_like( "vp_" + base_vpid.obj().looks_like, category,
1880 looks_like_jumps_limit - 1 );
1881 }
1882 case C_ITEM: {
1883 itype_id iid = itype_id( id );
1884 if( !iid.is_valid() ) {
1885 if( string_starts_with( id, "corpse_" ) ) {
1886 return find_tile_looks_like(
1887 itype_corpse.str(), category, looks_like_jumps_limit - 1
1888 );
1889 }
1890 return cata::nullopt;
1891 }
1892 return find_tile_looks_like( iid->looks_like.str(), category, looks_like_jumps_limit - 1 );
1893 }
1894
1895 default:
1896 return cata::nullopt;
1897 }
1898}
1899
1900bool cata_tiles::find_overlay_looks_like( const bool male, const std::string &overlay,
1901 std::string &draw_id )
1902{
1903 bool exists = false;
1904
1905 std::string looks_like;
1906 std::string over_type;
1907
1908 if( string_starts_with( overlay, "worn_" ) ) {
1909 looks_like = overlay.substr( 5 );
1910 over_type = "worn_";
1911 } else if( string_starts_with( overlay, "wielded_" ) ) {
1912 looks_like = overlay.substr( 8 );
1913 over_type = "wielded_";
1914 } else {
1915 looks_like = overlay;
1916 }
1917
1918 for( int cnt = 0; cnt < 10 && !looks_like.empty(); cnt++ ) {
1919 draw_id = ( male ? "overlay_male_" : "overlay_female_" ) + over_type + looks_like;
1920 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( draw_id ) ) {
1921 exists = true;
1922 break;
1923 }
1924 draw_id = "overlay_" + over_type + looks_like;
1925 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( draw_id ) ) {
1926 exists = true;
1927 break;
1928 }
1929 if( string_starts_with( looks_like, "mutation_active_" ) ) {
1930 looks_like = "mutation_" + looks_like.substr( 16 );
1931 continue;
1932 }
1933 itype_id iid = itype_id( looks_like );
1934 if( !iid.is_valid() ) {
1935 break;
1936 }
1937 looks_like = iid->looks_like.str();
1938 }
1939 return exists;
1940}
1941
1942bool cata_tiles::draw_from_id_string( const std::string &id, TILE_CATEGORY category,
1943 const std::string &subcategory, const tripoint &pos,
1944 int subtile, int rota, lit_level ll,
1945 bool apply_night_vision_goggles, int &height_3d, int overlay_count )
1946{
1947 // If the ID string does not produce a drawable tile
1948 // it will revert to the "unknown" tile.
1949 // The "unknown" tile is one that is highly visible so you kinda can't miss it :D
1950
1951 // check to make sure that we are drawing within a valid area
1952 // [0->width|height / tile_width|height]
1953
1954 half_open_rectangle<point> screen_bounds( o, o + point( screentile_width, screentile_height ) );
1955 if( !tile_iso &&
1956 !screen_bounds.contains( pos.xy() ) ) {
1957 return false;
1958 }
1959
1960 cata::optional<tile_lookup_res> res = find_tile_looks_like( id, category );
1961 const tile_type *tt = nullptr;
1962 if( res ) {
1963 tt = &( res->tile() );
1964 }
1965 const std::string &found_id = res ? ( res->id() ) : id;
1966
1967 if( !tt ) {
1968 uint32_t sym = UNKNOWN_UNICODE;
1969 nc_color col = c_white;
1970 if( category == C_FURNITURE ) {
1971 const furn_str_id fid( found_id );
1972 if( fid.is_valid() ) {
1973 const furn_t &f = fid.obj();
1974 sym = f.symbol();
1975 col = f.color();
1976 }
1977 } else if( category == C_TERRAIN ) {
1978 const ter_str_id tid( found_id );
1979 if( tid.is_valid() ) {
1980 const ter_t &t = tid.obj();
1981 sym = t.symbol();
1982 col = t.color();
1983 }
1984 } else if( category == C_MONSTER ) {
1985 const mtype_id mid( found_id );
1986 if( mid.is_valid() ) {
1987 const mtype &mt = mid.obj();
1988 sym = UTF8_getch( mt.sym );
1989 col = mt.color;
1990 }
1991 } else if( category == C_VEHICLE_PART ) {
1992 const vpart_id vpid( found_id.substr( 3 ) );
1993 if( vpid.is_valid() ) {
1994 const vpart_info &v = vpid.obj();
1995
1996 if( subtile == open_ ) {
1997 sym = '\'';
1998 } else if( subtile == broken ) {
1999 sym = v.sym_broken;
2000 } else {
2001 sym = v.sym;
2002 }
2003 subtile = -1;
2004
2005 tileray face = tileray( units::from_degrees( rota ) );
2006 sym = special_symbol( face.dir_symbol( sym ) );
2007 rota = 0;
2008
2009 col = v.color;
2010 }
2011 } else if( category == C_FIELD ) {
2012 const field_type_id fid = field_type_id( found_id );
2013 sym = fid.obj().get_codepoint();
2014 // TODO: field intensity?
2015 col = fid.obj().get_color();
2016 } else if( category == C_TRAP ) {
2017 const trap_str_id tmp( found_id );
2018 if( tmp.is_valid() ) {
2019 const trap &t = tmp.obj();
2020 sym = t.sym;
2021 col = t.color;
2022 }
2023 } else if( category == C_ITEM ) {
2024 item tmp;
2025 if( string_starts_with( found_id, "corpse_" ) ) {
2026 tmp = item( itype_corpse, calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
2027 } else {
2028 tmp = item( found_id, calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
2029 }
2030 sym = tmp.symbol().empty() ? ' ' : tmp.symbol().front();
2031 col = tmp.color();
2032 } else if( category == C_OVERMAP_TERRAIN ) {
2033 const oter_type_str_id tmp( id );
2034 if( tmp.is_valid() ) {
2035 sym = tmp->symbol;
2036 col = tmp->color;
2037 }
2038 } else if( category == C_OVERMAP_NOTE ) {
2039 sym = id[5];
2040 col = color_from_string( id.substr( 7, id.length() - 1 ) );
2041 }
2042 // Special cases for walls
2043 switch( sym ) {
2044 case LINE_XOXO:
2045 case LINE_XOXO_UNICODE:
2046 sym = LINE_XOXO_C;
2047 break;
2048 case LINE_OXOX:
2049 case LINE_OXOX_UNICODE:
2050 sym = LINE_OXOX_C;
2051 break;
2052 case LINE_XXOO:
2053 case LINE_XXOO_UNICODE:
2054 sym = LINE_XXOO_C;
2055 break;
2056 case LINE_OXXO:
2057 case LINE_OXXO_UNICODE:
2058 sym = LINE_OXXO_C;
2059 break;
2060 case LINE_OOXX:
2061 case LINE_OOXX_UNICODE:
2062 sym = LINE_OOXX_C;
2063 break;
2064 case LINE_XOOX:
2065 case LINE_XOOX_UNICODE:
2066 sym = LINE_XOOX_C;
2067 break;
2068 case LINE_XXXO:
2069 case LINE_XXXO_UNICODE:
2070 sym = LINE_XXXO_C;
2071 break;
2072 case LINE_XXOX:
2073 case LINE_XXOX_UNICODE:
2074 sym = LINE_XXOX_C;
2075 break;
2076 case LINE_XOXX:
2077 case LINE_XOXX_UNICODE:
2078 sym = LINE_XOXX_C;
2079 break;
2080 case LINE_OXXX:
2081 case LINE_OXXX_UNICODE:
2082 sym = LINE_OXXX_C;
2083 break;
2084 case LINE_XXXX:
2085 case LINE_XXXX_UNICODE:
2086 sym = LINE_XXXX_C;
2087 break;
2088 default:
2089 // sym goes unchanged
2090 break;
2091 }
2092
2093 if( sym != 0 && sym < 256 ) {
2094 // see cursesport.cpp, function wattron
2095 const int pairNumber = col.to_color_pair_index();
2096 const cata_cursesport::pairs &colorpair = cata_cursesport::colorpairs[pairNumber];
2097 // What about isBlink?
2098 const bool isBold = col.is_bold();
2099 const int FG = colorpair.FG + ( isBold ? 8 : 0 );
2100 std::string generic_id = get_ascii_tile_id( sym, FG, -1 );
2101
2102 // do not rotate fallback tiles!
2103 if( sym != LINE_XOXO_C && sym != LINE_OXOX_C ) {
2104 rota = 0;
2105 }
2106 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( generic_id ) ) {
2107 return draw_from_id_string( generic_id, pos, subtile, rota,
2108 ll, apply_night_vision_goggles, overlay_count );
2109 }
2110 // Try again without color this time (using default color).
2111 generic_id = get_ascii_tile_id( sym, -1, -1 );
2112 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( generic_id ) ) {
2113 return draw_from_id_string( generic_id, pos, subtile, rota,
2114 ll, apply_night_vision_goggles, overlay_count );
2115 }
2116 }
2117 }
2118
2119 // if id is not found, try to find a tile for the category+subcategory combination
2120 if( !tt ) {
2121 const std::string &category_id = TILE_CATEGORY_IDS[category];
2122 if( !category_id.empty() && !subcategory.empty() ) {
2123 tt = tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( "unknown_" + category_id + "_" + subcategory );
2124 }
2125 }
2126
2127 // if at this point we have no tile, try just the category
2128 if( !tt ) {
2129 const std::string &category_id = TILE_CATEGORY_IDS[category];
2130 if( !category_id.empty() ) {
2131 tt = tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( "unknown_" + category_id );
2132 }
2133 }
2134
2135 // if we still have no tile, we're out of luck, fall back to unknown
2136 if( !tt ) {
2137 tt = tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( "unknown" );
2138 }
2139
2140 // this really shouldn't happen, but the tileset creator might have forgotten to define an unknown tile
2141 if( !tt ) {
2142 return false;
2143 }
2144
2145 const tile_type &display_tile = *tt;
2146 // check to see if the display_tile is multitile, and if so if it has the key related to subtile
2147 if( subtile != -1 && display_tile.multitile ) {
2148 const auto &display_subtiles = display_tile.available_subtiles;
2149 const auto end = std::end( display_subtiles );
2150 if( std::find( begin( display_subtiles ), end, multitile_keys[subtile] ) != end ) {
2151 // append subtile name to tile and re-find display_tile
2152 return draw_from_id_string( found_id + "_" + multitile_keys[subtile],
2153 category, subcategory, pos, -1, rota, ll, apply_night_vision_goggles,
2154 height_3d, overlay_count );
2155 }
2156 }
2157
2158 // translate from player-relative to screen relative tile position
2159 const point screen_pos = player_to_screen( pos.xy() );
2160
2161 auto simple_point_hash = []( const auto & p ) {
2162 return p.x + p.y * 65536;
2163 };
2164
2165 bool has_variations = display_tile.fg.size() > 1 || display_tile.bg.size() > 1;
2166 bool variations_enabled = !display_tile.animated || idle_animations.enabled();
2167 // with animated tiles, seed is used for stagger
2168 bool seed_for_animation = has_variations && variations_enabled && display_tile.animated;
2169 bool seed_from_map_coords = false;
2170
2171 // seed the PRNG to get a reproducible random int
2172 // TODO: faster solution here
2173 unsigned int seed = 0;
2174 map &here = get_map();
2175 // TODO: determine ways other than category to differentiate more types of sprites
2176 switch( category ) {
2177 case C_TERRAIN:
2178 case C_FIELD:
2179 case C_LIGHTING:
2180 // stationary map tiles, seed based on map coordinates
2181 seed_from_map_coords = true;
2182 break;
2183 case C_VEHICLE_PART:
2184 // vehicle parts, seed based on coordinates within the vehicle
2185 // TODO: also use some vehicle id, for less predictability
2186 {
2187 // new scope for variable declarations
2188 const auto vp_override = vpart_override.find( pos );
2189 const bool vp_overridden = vp_override != vpart_override.end();
2190 if( vp_overridden ) {
2191 const vpart_id &vp_id = std::get<0>( vp_override->second );
2192 if( vp_id ) {
2193 const point &mount = std::get<4>( vp_override->second );
2194 seed = simple_point_hash( mount );
2195 }
2196 } else {
2197 const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( pos );
2198 if( vp ) {
2199 seed = simple_point_hash( vp->mount() );
2200 }
2201 }
2202
2203 // convert vehicle 360-degree direction (0=E,45=SE, etc) to 4-way tile
2204 // rotation (0=N,1=W,etc)
2205 tileray face = tileray( units::from_degrees( rota ) );
2206 rota = 3 - face.dir4();
2207
2208 }
2209 break;
2210 case C_FURNITURE: {
2211 // If the furniture is not movable, we'll allow seeding by the position
2212 // since we won't get the behavior that occurs where the tile constantly
2213 // changes when the player grabs the furniture and drags it, causing the
2214 // seed to change.
2215 const furn_str_id fid( found_id );
2216 if( fid.is_valid() ) {
2217 const furn_t &f = fid.obj();
2218 if( !f.is_movable() ) {
2219 seed = simple_point_hash( here.getabs( pos ) );
2220 }
2221 }
2222 }
2223 break;
2224 case C_ITEM:
2225 case C_TRAP:
2226 if( seed_for_animation ) {
2227 seed_from_map_coords = true;
2228 }
2229 // TODO: come up with ways to make random sprites consistent for these types
2230 break;
2231 case C_OVERMAP_TERRAIN:
2232 seed = simple_point_hash( pos );
2233 break;
2234 case C_NONE:
2235 case C_BULLET:
2236 case C_HIT_ENTITY:
2237 case C_WEATHER:
2238 // TODO: come up with ways to make random sprites consistent for these types
2239 break;
2240 case C_MONSTER:
2241 // FIXME: add persistent id to Creature type, instead of using monster pointer address
2242 if( monster_override.find( pos ) == monster_override.end() ) {
2243 seed = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>( g->critter_at<monster>( pos ) );
2244 }
2245 break;
2246 default:
2247 // player
2248 if( string_starts_with( found_id, "player_" ) ) {
2249 seed = g->u.name[0];
2250 break;
2251 }
2252 // NPC
2253 if( string_starts_with( found_id, "npc_" ) ) {
2254 if( npc *const guy = g->critter_at<npc>( pos ) ) {
2255 seed = guy->getID().get_value();
2256 break;
2257 }
2258 }
2259 }
2260
2261 // make sure we aren't going to rotate the tile if it shouldn't be rotated
2262 if( !display_tile.rotates && !( category == C_NONE ) && !( category == C_MONSTER ) ) {
2263 rota = 0;
2264 }
2265
2266 unsigned int loc_rand = 0;
2267 // only bother mixing up a hash/random value if the tile has some sprites to randomly pick between
2268 // or has an idle animation and idle animations are enabled
2269 if( has_variations && variations_enabled ) {
2270 if( seed_from_map_coords ) {
2271 seed = simple_point_hash( g->m.getabs( pos ) );
2272 }
2273 static const auto rot32 = []( const unsigned int x, const int k ) {
2274 return ( x << k ) | ( x >> ( 32 - k ) );
2275 };
2276 // use a fair mix function to turn the "random" seed into a random int
2277 // taken from public domain code at http://burtleburtle.net/bob/c/lookup3.c 2015/12/11
2278 unsigned int a = seed, b = -seed, c = seed * seed;
2279 c ^= b;
2280 c -= rot32( b, 14 );
2281 a ^= c;
2282 a -= rot32( c, 11 );
2283 b ^= a;
2284 b -= rot32( a, 25 );
2285 c ^= b;
2286 c -= rot32( b, 16 );
2287 a ^= c;
2288 a -= rot32( c, 4 );
2289 b ^= a;
2290 b -= rot32( a, 14 );
2291 c ^= b;
2292 c -= rot32( b, 24 );
2293 loc_rand = c;
2294
2295 // idle tile animations:
2296 if( display_tile.animated ) {
2297 idle_animations.mark_present();
2298 // offset by loc_rand so that everything does not blink at the same time:
2299 int frame = idle_animations.current_frame() + loc_rand;
2300 int frames_in_loop = display_tile.fg.get_weight();
2301 if( frames_in_loop == 1 ) {
2302 frames_in_loop = display_tile.bg.get_weight();
2303 }
2304 // loc_rand is actually the weighed index of the selected tile, and
2305 // for animations the "weight" is the number of frames to show the tile for:
2306 loc_rand = frame % frames_in_loop;
2307 }
2308 }
2309
2310 //draw it!
2311 draw_tile_at( display_tile, screen_pos, loc_rand, rota, ll,
2312 apply_night_vision_goggles, height_3d, overlay_count );
2313
2314 return true;
2315}
2316
2317bool cata_tiles::draw_sprite_at(
2318 const tile_type &tile, const weighted_int_list<std::vector<int>> &svlist,
2319 const point &p, unsigned int loc_rand, bool rota_fg, int rota, lit_level ll,
2320 bool apply_night_vision_goggles, int overlay_count )
2321{
2322 int nullint = 0;
2323 return cata_tiles::draw_sprite_at( tile, svlist, p, loc_rand, rota_fg, rota, ll,
2324 apply_night_vision_goggles, nullint, overlay_count );
2325}
2326
2327bool cata_tiles::draw_sprite_at(
2328 const tile_type &tile, const weighted_int_list<std::vector<int>> &svlist,
2329 const point &p, unsigned int loc_rand, bool rota_fg, int rota, lit_level ll,
2330 bool apply_night_vision_goggles, int &height_3d, int overlay_count )
2331{
2332 auto picked = svlist.pick( loc_rand );
2333 if( !picked ) {
2334 return true;
2335 }
2336 auto &spritelist = *picked;
2337 if( spritelist.empty() ) {
2338 return true;
2339 }
2340
2341 int ret = 0;
2342 // blit foreground based on rotation
2343 bool rotate_sprite = false;
2344 int sprite_num = 0;
2345 if( !rota_fg && spritelist.size() == 1 ) {
2346 // don't rotate, a background tile without manual rotations
2347 rotate_sprite = false;
2348 sprite_num = 0;
2349 } else if( spritelist.size() == 1 ) {
2350 // just one tile, apply SDL sprite rotation if not in isometric mode
2351 rotate_sprite = true;
2352 sprite_num = 0;
2353 } else {
2354 // multiple rotated tiles defined, don't apply sprite rotation after picking one
2355 rotate_sprite = false;
2356 // two tiles, tile 0 is N/S, tile 1 is E/W
2357 // four tiles, 0=N, 1=E, 2=S, 3=W
2358 // extending this to more than 4 rotated tiles will require changing rota to degrees
2359 sprite_num = rota % spritelist.size();
2360 }
2361
2362 const texture *sprite_tex = tileset_ptr->get_tile( spritelist[sprite_num] );
2363
2364 //use night vision colors when in use
2365 //then use low light tile if available
2366 if( ll == lit_level::MEMORIZED ) {
2367 if( const auto ptr = tileset_ptr->get_memory_tile( spritelist[sprite_num] ) ) {
2368 sprite_tex = ptr;
2369 }
2370 } else if( apply_night_vision_goggles ) {
2371 if( ll != lit_level::LOW ) {
2372 if( const auto ptr = tileset_ptr->get_overexposed_tile( spritelist[sprite_num] ) ) {
2373 sprite_tex = ptr;
2374 }
2375 } else {
2376 if( const auto ptr = tileset_ptr->get_night_tile( spritelist[sprite_num] ) ) {
2377 sprite_tex = ptr;
2378 }
2379 }
2380 } else if( overlay_count > 0 && static_z_effect ) {
2381 if( const auto ptr = tileset_ptr->get_z_overlay( spritelist[sprite_num] ) ) {
2382 sprite_tex = ptr;
2383 }
2384 } else if( ll == lit_level::LOW ) {
2385 if( const auto ptr = tileset_ptr->get_shadow_tile( spritelist[sprite_num] ) ) {
2386 sprite_tex = ptr;
2387 }
2388 }
2389
2390 const auto overlay = tileset_ptr->get_z_overlay( spritelist[sprite_num] );
2391
2392 int width = 0;
2393 int height = 0;
2394 std::tie( width, height ) = sprite_tex->dimension();
2395
2396 SDL_Rect destination;
2397 destination.x = p.x + tile.offset.x * tile_width / tileset_ptr->get_tile_width();
2398 destination.y = p.y + ( tile.offset.y - height_3d ) * tile_width / tileset_ptr->get_tile_width();
2399 destination.w = width * tile_width / tileset_ptr->get_tile_width();
2400 destination.h = height * tile_height / tileset_ptr->get_tile_height();
2401
2402 auto render = [&]( const int rotation, const SDL_RendererFlip flip ) {
2403 int ret = sprite_tex->render_copy_ex( renderer, &destination, rotation, nullptr, flip );
2404 if( !static_z_effect && overlay && overlay_count > 0 ) {
2405 overlay->set_alpha_mod( std::min( 192, ( 1 + overlay_count ) * 24 ) );
2406 overlay->render_copy_ex( renderer, &destination, rotation, nullptr, flip );
2407 }
2408 return ret;
2409 };
2410
2411 if( rotate_sprite ) {
2412 switch( rota ) {
2413 default:
2414 case 0:
2415 // unrotated (and 180, with just two sprites)
2416 ret = render( 0, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2417 break;
2418 case 1:
2419 // 90 degrees (and 270, with just two sprites)
2420 if( !tile_iso ) {
2421 // never rotate isometric tiles
2422 ret = render( -90, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2423 } else {
2424 ret = render( 0, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2425 }
2426 break;
2427 case 2:
2428 // 180 degrees, implemented with flips instead of rotation
2429 if( !tile_iso ) {
2430 // never flip isometric tiles vertically
2431 ret = render( 0, static_cast<SDL_RendererFlip>( SDL_FLIP_HORIZONTAL | SDL_FLIP_VERTICAL ) );
2432 } else {
2433 ret = render( 0, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2434 }
2435 break;
2436 case 3:
2437 // 270 degrees
2438 if( !tile_iso ) {
2439 // never rotate isometric tiles
2440 ret = render( 90, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2441 } else {
2442 ret = render( 0, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2443 }
2444 break;
2445 case 4:
2446 // flip horizontally
2447 ret = render( 0, SDL_FLIP_HORIZONTAL );
2448 }
2449 } else {
2450 // don't rotate, same as case 0 above
2451 ret = render( 0, SDL_FLIP_NONE );
2452 }
2453
2454 printErrorIf( ret != 0, "SDL_RenderCopyEx() failed" );
2455 // this reference passes all the way back up the call chain back to
2456 // cata_tiles::draw() std::vector<tile_render_info> draw_points[].height_3d
2457 // where we are accumulating the height of every sprite stacked up in a tile
2458 height_3d += tile.height_3d;
2459 return true;
2460}
2461
2462bool cata_tiles::draw_tile_at(
2463 const tile_type &tile, const point &p, unsigned int loc_rand, int rota,
2464 lit_level ll, bool apply_night_vision_goggles, int &height_3d, int overlay_count )
2465{
2466 draw_sprite_at( tile, tile.bg, p, loc_rand, /*fg:*/ false, rota, ll,
2467 apply_night_vision_goggles, overlay_count );
2468 draw_sprite_at( tile, tile.fg, p, loc_rand, /*fg:*/ true, rota, ll,
2469 apply_night_vision_goggles, height_3d, overlay_count );
2470 return true;
2471}
2472
2473bool cata_tiles::would_apply_vision_effects( const visibility_type visibility ) const
2474{
2475 return visibility != VIS_CLEAR;
2476}
2477
2478bool cata_tiles::apply_vision_effects( const tripoint &pos,
2479 const visibility_type visibility )
2480{
2481 if( !would_apply_vision_effects( visibility ) ) {
2482 return false;
2483 }
2484 const std::string *light_name = nullptr;
2485 switch( visibility ) {
2486 case VIS_HIDDEN: {
2487 light_name = &STATIC( std::string( "lighting_hidden" ) );
2488 break;
2489 }
2490 case VIS_LIT: {
2491 light_name = &STATIC( std::string( "lighting_lowlight_light" ) );
2492 break;
2493 }
2494 case VIS_BOOMER: {
2495 light_name = &STATIC( std::string( "lighting_boomered_light" ) );
2496 break;
2497 }
2498 case VIS_BOOMER_DARK: {
2499 light_name = &STATIC( std::string( "lighting_boomered_dark" ) );
2500 break;
2501 }
2502 case VIS_DARK: {
2503 light_name = &STATIC( std::string( "lighting_lowlight_dark" ) );
2504 break;
2505 }
2506 case VIS_CLEAR:
2507 // should never happen
2508 break;
2509 }
2510
2511 // lighting is never rotated, though, could possibly add in random rotation?
2512 draw_from_id_string( *light_name, C_LIGHTING, empty_string, pos, 0, 0, lit_level::LIT, false, 0 );
2513
2514 return true;
2515}
2516
2517bool cata_tiles::draw_block( const tripoint &p, SDL_Color color, int scale )
2518{
2519 SDL_Rect rect;
2520 rect.h = tile_width / scale;
2521 rect.w = tile_height / scale;
2522
2523 if( tile_iso ) {
2524 rect.h = ( rect.h * 2 ) / 3;
2525 rect.w = ( rect.w * 3 ) / 4;
2526 }
2527 // translate from player-relative to screen relative tile position
2528 point screen;
2529 if( tile_iso ) {
2530 screen.x = ( ( p.x - o.x ) - ( o.y - p.y ) + screentile_width - 2 ) * tile_width / 2 +
2531 op.x;
2532 // y uses tile_width because width is definitive for iso tiles
2533 // tile footprints are half as tall as wide, arbitrarily tall
2534 screen.y = ( ( p.y - o.y ) - ( p.x - o.x ) - 4 ) * tile_width / 4 +
2535 screentile_height * tile_height / 2 + // TODO: more obvious centering math
2536 op.y;
2537 } else {
2538 screen.x = ( p.x - o.x ) * tile_width + op.x;
2539 screen.y = ( p.y - o.y ) * tile_height + op.y;
2540 }
2541 rect.x = screen.x + ( tile_width - rect.w ) / 2;
2542 rect.y = screen.y + ( tile_height - rect.h ) / 2;
2543 if( tile_iso ) {
2544 rect.y += tile_height / 8;
2545 }
2546
2547 geometry->rect( renderer, rect, color );
2548 return true;
2549}
2550
2551bool cata_tiles::draw_terrain( const tripoint &p, const lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2552 const bool ( &invisible )[5], int z_drop )
2553{
2554 map &here = get_map();
2555 const auto override = terrain_override.find( p );
2556 const bool overridden = override != terrain_override.end();
2557 bool neighborhood_overridden = overridden;
2558 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2559 for( const point &dir : neighborhood ) {
2560 if( terrain_override.find( p + dir ) != terrain_override.end() ) {
2561 neighborhood_overridden = true;
2562 break;
2563 }
2564 }
2565 }
2566 // first memorize the actual terrain
2567 const ter_id &t = here.ter( p );
2568 if( t && !invisible[0] ) {
2569 int subtile = 0;
2570 int rotation = 0;
2571 int connect_group = 0;
2572 if( t.obj().connects( connect_group ) ) {
2573 get_connect_values( p, subtile, rotation, connect_group, {} );
2574 // re-memorize previously seen terrain in case new connections have been seen
2575 here.set_memory_seen_cache_dirty( p );
2576 } else {
2577 get_terrain_orientation( p, rotation, subtile, {}, invisible );
2578 // do something to get other terrain orientation values
2579 }
2580 const std::string &tname = t.id().str();
2581 if( here.check_seen_cache( p ) && t != t_open_air ) {
2582 g->u.memorize_tile( here.getabs( p ), tname, subtile, rotation );
2583 }
2584 // draw the actual terrain if there's no override
2585 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2586 //If it's open air just draw a flat color
2587 if( t == t_open_air ) {
2588 return draw_block( p, curses_color_to_SDL( c_cyan ), 4 );
2589 } else {
2590 return draw_from_id_string( tname, C_TERRAIN, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, ll,
2591 nv_goggles_activated, height_3d, z_drop );
2592 }
2593 }
2594 }
2595 if( invisible[0] ? overridden : neighborhood_overridden ) {
2596 // and then draw the override terrain
2597 const ter_id &t2 = overridden ? override->second : t;
2598 if( t2 ) {
2599 // both the current and neighboring overrides may change the appearance
2600 // of the tile, so always re-calculate it.
2601 int subtile = 0;
2602 int rotation = 0;
2603 int connect_group = 0;
2604 if( t2.obj().connects( connect_group ) ) {
2605 get_connect_values( p, subtile, rotation, connect_group, terrain_override );
2606 } else {
2607 get_terrain_orientation( p, rotation, subtile, terrain_override, invisible );
2608 }
2609 const std::string &tname = t2.id().str();
2610 // tile overrides are never memorized
2611 // tile overrides are always shown with full visibility
2612 const lit_level lit = overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2613 const bool nv = overridden ? false : nv_goggles_activated;
2614 return draw_from_id_string( tname, C_TERRAIN, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, lit, nv,
2615 height_3d, z_drop );
2616 }
2617 } else if( invisible[0] && has_terrain_memory_at( p ) ) {
2618 // try drawing memory if invisible and not overridden
2619 const auto &t = get_terrain_memory_at( p );
2620
2621 return draw_from_id_string( t.tile, C_TERRAIN, empty_string, p, t.subtile, t.rotation,
2622 lit_level::MEMORIZED, nv_goggles_activated, height_3d, z_drop );
2623 }
2624 return false;
2625}
2626

2628{

2630 const memorized_terrain_tile t = g->u.get_memorized_tile( get_map().getabs( p ) );
2631 return !t.tile.empty();
2632 }
2633 return false;
2634}

2641 return true;
2642 }
2643 }
2644 return false;
2645}

2723
2724bool cata_tiles::draw_furniture( const tripoint &p, const lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2725 const bool ( &invisible )[5], int z_drop )
2726{
2727 const auto override = furniture_override.find( p );
2728 const bool overridden = override != furniture_override.end();
2729 bool neighborhood_overridden = overridden;
2730 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2731 for( const point &dir : neighborhood ) {
2732 if( furniture_override.find( p + dir ) != furniture_override.end() ) {
2733 neighborhood_overridden = true;
2734 break;
2735 }
2736 }
2737 }
2738 map &here = get_map();
2739 // first memorize the actual furniture
2740 const furn_id &f = here.furn( p );
2741 if( f && !invisible[0] ) {
2742 const int neighborhood[4] = {
2743 static_cast<int>( here.furn( p + point_south ) ),
2744 static_cast<int>( here.furn( p + point_east ) ),
2745 static_cast<int>( here.furn( p + point_west ) ),
2746 static_cast<int>( here.furn( p + point_north ) )
2747 };
2748 int subtile = 0;
2749 int rotation = 0;
2750 get_tile_values( f.to_i(), neighborhood, subtile, rotation );
2751 const std::string &fname = f.id().str();
2752 if( here.check_seen_cache( p ) ) {
2753 g->u.memorize_tile( here.getabs( p ), fname, subtile, rotation );
2754 }
2755 // draw the actual furniture if there's no override
2756 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2757 return draw_from_id_string( fname, C_FURNITURE, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, ll,
2758 nv_goggles_activated, height_3d, z_drop );
2759 }
2760 }
2761 if( invisible[0] ? overridden : neighborhood_overridden ) {
2762 // and then draw the override furniture
2763 const furn_id &f2 = overridden ? override->second : f;
2764 if( f2 ) {
2765 // both the current and neighboring overrides may change the appearance
2766 // of the tile, so always re-calculate it.
2767 const auto furn = [&]( const tripoint & q, const bool invis ) -> furn_id {
2768 const auto it = furniture_override.find( q );
2769 return it != furniture_override.end() ? it->second :
2770 ( !overridden || !invis ) ? here.furn( q ) : f_null;
2771 };
2772 const int neighborhood[4] = {
2773 static_cast<int>( furn( p + point_south, invisible[1] ) ),
2774 static_cast<int>( furn( p + point_east, invisible[2] ) ),
2775 static_cast<int>( furn( p + point_west, invisible[3] ) ),
2776 static_cast<int>( furn( p + point_north, invisible[4] ) )
2777 };
2778 int subtile = 0;
2779 int rotation = 0;
2780 get_tile_values( f2.to_i(), neighborhood, subtile, rotation );
2781 const std::string &fname = f2.id().str();
2782 // tile overrides are never memorized
2783 // tile overrides are always shown with full visibility
2784 const lit_level lit = overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2785 const bool nv = overridden ? false : nv_goggles_activated;
2786 return draw_from_id_string( fname, C_FURNITURE, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, lit, nv,
2787 height_3d, z_drop );
2788 }
2789 } else if( invisible[0] && has_furniture_memory_at( p ) ) {
2790 // try drawing memory if invisible and not overridden
2791 const auto &t = get_furniture_memory_at( p );
2792 return draw_from_id_string( t.tile, C_FURNITURE, empty_string, p, t.subtile, t.rotation,
2793 lit_level::MEMORIZED, nv_goggles_activated, height_3d, z_drop );
2794 }
2795 return false;
2796}
2797
2798bool cata_tiles::draw_trap( const tripoint &p, const lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2799 const bool ( &invisible )[5], int z_drop )
2800{
2801 const auto override = trap_override.find( p );
2802 const bool overridden = override != trap_override.end();
2803 bool neighborhood_overridden = overridden;
2804 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2805 for( const point &dir : neighborhood ) {
2806 if( trap_override.find( p + dir ) != trap_override.end() ) {
2807 neighborhood_overridden = true;
2808 break;
2809 }
2810 }
2811 }
2812
2813 map &here = get_map();
2814 // first memorize the actual trap
2815 const trap_id &tr = here.tr_at( p ).loadid;
2816 if( tr && !invisible[0] && tr.obj().can_see( p, g->u ) ) {
2817 const int neighborhood[4] = {
2818 static_cast<int>( here.tr_at( p + point_south ).loadid ),
2819 static_cast<int>( here.tr_at( p + point_east ).loadid ),
2820 static_cast<int>( here.tr_at( p + point_west ).loadid ),
2821 static_cast<int>( here.tr_at( p + point_north ).loadid )
2822 };
2823 int subtile = 0;
2824 int rotation = 0;
2825 get_tile_values( tr.to_i(), neighborhood, subtile, rotation );
2826 const std::string trname = tr.id().str();
2827 if( here.check_seen_cache( p ) && tr != tr_ledge ) {
2828 g->u.memorize_tile( here.getabs( p ), trname, subtile, rotation );
2829 }
2830 // draw the actual trap if there's no override
2831 if( !neighborhood_overridden ) {
2832 return draw_from_id_string( trname, C_TRAP, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, ll,
2833 nv_goggles_activated, height_3d, z_drop );
2834 }
2835 }
2836 if( overridden || ( !invisible[0] && neighborhood_overridden && tr.obj().can_see( p, g->u ) ) ) {
2837 // and then draw the override trap
2838 const trap_id &tr2 = overridden ? override->second : tr;
2839 if( tr2 ) {
2840 // both the current and neighboring overrides may change the appearance
2841 // of the tile, so always re-calculate it.
2842 const auto tr_at = [&]( const tripoint & q, const bool invis ) -> trap_id {
2843 const auto it = trap_override.find( q );
2844 return it != trap_override.end() ? it->second :
2845 ( !overridden || !invis ) ? here.tr_at( q ).loadid : tr_null;
2846 };
2847 const int neighborhood[4] = {
2848 static_cast<int>( tr_at( p + point_south, invisible[1] ) ),
2849 static_cast<int>( tr_at( p + point_east, invisible[2] ) ),
2850 static_cast<int>( tr_at( p + point_west, invisible[3] ) ),
2851 static_cast<int>( tr_at( p + point_north, invisible[4] ) )
2852 };
2853 int subtile = 0;
2854 int rotation = 0;
2855 get_tile_values( tr2.to_i(), neighborhood, subtile, rotation );
2856 const std::string &trname = tr2.id().str();
2857 // tile overrides are never memorized
2858 // tile overrides are always shown with full visibility
2859 const lit_level lit = overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2860 const bool nv = overridden ? false : nv_goggles_activated;
2861 return draw_from_id_string( trname, C_TRAP, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation, lit, nv,
2862 height_3d, z_drop );
2863 }
2864 } else if( invisible[0] && has_trap_memory_at( p ) ) {
2865 // try drawing memory if invisible and not overridden
2866 const auto &t = get_trap_memory_at( p );
2867 return draw_from_id_string( t.tile, C_TRAP, empty_string, p, t.subtile, t.rotation,
2868 lit_level::MEMORIZED, nv_goggles_activated, height_3d, z_drop );
2869 }
2870 return false;
2871}
2872
2873bool cata_tiles::draw_graffiti( const tripoint &p, const lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2874 const bool ( &invisible )[5], int z_drop )
2875{
2876 const auto override = graffiti_override.find( p );
2877 const bool overridden = override != graffiti_override.end();
2878 if( overridden ? !override->second : ( invisible[0] || !get_map().has_graffiti_at( p ) ) ) {
2879 return false;
2880 }
2881 const lit_level lit = overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2882 return draw_from_id_string( "graffiti", C_NONE, empty_string, p, 0, 0, lit, false, height_3d,
2883 z_drop );
2884}
2885
2886bool cata_tiles::draw_field_or_item( const tripoint &p, const lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2887 const bool ( &invisible )[5], int z_drop )
2888{
2889 if( !fov_3d && z_drop > 0 ) {
2890 return false;
2891 }
2892 const auto fld_override = field_override.find( p );
2893 const bool fld_overridden = fld_override != field_override.end();
2894 map &here = get_map();
2895 const field_type_id &fld = fld_overridden ?
2896 fld_override->second : here.field_at( p ).displayed_field_type();
2897 bool ret_draw_field = false;
2898 bool ret_draw_items = false;
2899 if( ( fld_overridden || !invisible[0] ) && fld.obj().display_field ) {
2900 const lit_level lit = fld_overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2901 const bool nv = fld_overridden ? false : nv_goggles_activated;
2902
2903 auto field_at = [&]( const tripoint & q, const bool invis ) -> field_type_id {
2904 const auto it = field_override.find( q );
2905 return it != field_override.end() ? it->second :
2906 ( !fld_overridden || !invis ) ? here.field_at( q ).displayed_field_type() : fd_null;
2907 };
2908 // for rotation information
2909 const int neighborhood[4] = {
2910 static_cast<int>( field_at( p + point_south, invisible[1] ) ),
2911 static_cast<int>( field_at( p + point_east, invisible[2] ) ),
2912 static_cast<int>( field_at( p + point_west, invisible[3] ) ),
2913 static_cast<int>( field_at( p + point_north, invisible[4] ) )
2914 };
2915
2916 int subtile = 0;
2917 int rotation = 0;
2918 get_tile_values( fld.to_i(), neighborhood, subtile, rotation );
2919
2920 ret_draw_field = draw_from_id_string( fld.id().str(), C_FIELD, empty_string, p, subtile,
2921 rotation, lit, nv, z_drop );
2922 }
2923 if( fld.obj().display_items ) {
2924 const auto it_override = item_override.find( p );
2925 const bool it_overridden = it_override != item_override.end();
2926
2927 itype_id it_id;
2928 mtype_id mon_id;
2929 bool hilite;
2930 const itype *it_type;
2931 if( it_overridden ) {
2932 it_id = std::get<0>( it_override->second );
2933 mon_id = std::get<1>( it_override->second );
2934 hilite = std::get<2>( it_override->second );
2935 it_type = &*it_id;
2936 } else if( !invisible[0] && here.sees_some_items( p, g->u ) ) {
2937 const maptile &tile = here.maptile_at( p );
2938 const item &itm = tile.get_uppermost_item();
2939 const mtype *const mon = itm.get_mtype();
2940 it_id = itm.typeId();
2941 mon_id = mon ? mon->id : mtype_id::NULL_ID();
2942 hilite = tile.get_item_count() > 1;
2943 it_type = itm.type;
2944 } else {
2945 it_type = nullptr;
2946 }
2947 if( it_type && !it_id.is_null() ) {
2948 const std::string disp_id = it_id == itype_corpse && mon_id ?
2949 "corpse_" + mon_id.str() : it_id.str();
2950 const std::string it_category = it_type->get_item_type_string();
2951 const lit_level lit = it_overridden ? lit_level::LIT : ll;
2952 const bool nv = it_overridden ? false : nv_goggles_activated;
2953
2954 ret_draw_items = draw_from_id_string( disp_id, C_ITEM, it_category, p, 0, 0, lit,
2955 nv, height_3d, z_drop );
2956 if( ret_draw_items && hilite ) {
2957 draw_item_highlight( p );
2958 }
2959 }
2960 }
2961 return ret_draw_field && ret_draw_items;
2962}
2963
2964bool cata_tiles::draw_vpart( const tripoint &p, lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
2965 const bool ( &invisible )[5], int z_drop )
2966{
2967 const auto override = vpart_override.find( p );
2968 const bool overridden = override != vpart_override.end();
2969 map &here = get_map();
2970 // first memorize the actual vpart
2971 const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( p );
2972 if( vp && !invisible[0] ) {
2973 const vehicle &veh = vp->vehicle();
2974 int veh_part = vp->part_index();
2975
2976 // Gets the visible part, should work fine once tileset vp_ids are updated to work with the vehicle part json ids
2977 // get the vpart_id
2978 char part_mod = 0;
2979 const Creature *critter = g->critter_at( p, true );
2980 const vpart_id &vp_id = veh.part_id_string( veh_part, z_drop > 0 && critter == nullptr, part_mod );
2981 const int subtile = part_mod == 1 ? open_ : part_mod == 2 ? broken : 0;
2982 const int rotation = std::round( to_degrees( veh.face.dir() ) );
2983 const std::string vpname = "vp_" + vp_id.str();
2984 avatar &you = get_avatar();
2985 if( !veh.forward_velocity() && !veh.player_in_control( you ) &&
2986 here.check_seen_cache( p ) ) {
2987 you.memorize_tile( here.getabs( p ), vpname, subtile, rotation );
2988 }
2989 if( !overridden ) {
2990 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> cargopart = vp.part_with_feature( "CARGO", true );
2991 const bool draw_highlight = cargopart && !veh.get_items( cargopart->part_index() ).empty();
2992 const bool ret = draw_from_id_string( vpname, C_VEHICLE_PART, empty_string, p, subtile, rotation,
2993 ll, nv_goggles_activated, height_3d, z_drop );
2994 if( ret && draw_highlight ) {
2995 draw_item_highlight( p );
2996 }
2997 return ret;
2998 }
2999 }
3000 if( overridden ) {
3001 // and then draw the override vpart
3002 const vpart_id &vp2 = std::get<0>( override->second );
3003 if( vp2 ) {
3004 const char part_mod = std::get<1>( override->second );
3005 const int subtile = part_mod == 1 ? open_ : part_mod == 2 ? broken : 0;
3006 const units::angle rotation = std::get<2>( override->second );
3007 const int draw_highlight = std::get<3>( override->second );
3008 const std::string vpname = "vp_" + vp2.str();
3009 // tile overrides are never memorized
3010 // tile overrides are always shown with full visibility
3011 const bool ret = draw_from_id_string( vpname, C_VEHICLE_PART, empty_string, p,
3012 subtile, to_degrees( rotation ), lit_level::LIT,
3013 false, height_3d, z_drop );
3014 if( ret && draw_highlight ) {
3015 draw_item_highlight( p );
3016 }
3017 return ret;
3018 }
3019 } else if( invisible[0] && has_vpart_memory_at( p ) ) {
3020 // try drawing memory if invisible and not overridden
3021 const auto &t = get_vpart_memory_at( p );
3022 return draw_from_id_string( t.tile, C_VEHICLE_PART, empty_string, p, t.subtile, t.rotation,
3023 lit_level::MEMORIZED, nv_goggles_activated, height_3d, z_drop );
3024 }
3025 return false;
3026}
3027
3028bool cata_tiles::draw_critter_at( const tripoint &p, lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
3029 const bool ( &invisible )[5], int z_drop )
3030{
3031 if( !fov_3d && z_drop > 0 ) {
3032 return false;
3033 }
3034 bool result;
3035 bool is_player;
3036 bool sees_player;
3037 Creature::Attitude attitude;
3038 const auto override = monster_override.find( p );
3039 if( override != monster_override.end() ) {
3040 const mtype_id id = std::get<0>( override->second );
3041 if( !id ) {
3042 return false;
3043 }
3044 is_player = false;
3045 sees_player = false;
3046 attitude = std::get<3>( override->second );
3047 const std::string &chosen_id = id.str();
3048 const std::string &ent_subcategory = id.obj().species.empty() ?
3049 empty_string : id.obj().species.begin()->str();
3050 result = draw_from_id_string( chosen_id, C_MONSTER, ent_subcategory, p, corner, 0,
3051 lit_level::LIT, false, height_3d, z_drop );
3052 } else if( !invisible[0] ) {
3053 const Creature *pcritter = g->critter_at( p, true );
3054 if( pcritter == nullptr ) {
3055 return false;
3056 }
3057 const Creature &critter = *pcritter;
3058
3059 if( !g->u.sees( critter ) ) {
3060 if( g->u.sees_with_infrared( critter ) || g->u.sees_with_specials( critter ) ) {
3061 return draw_from_id_string( "infrared_creature", C_NONE, empty_string, p, 0, 0,
3062 lit_level::LIT, false, height_3d, z_drop );
3063 }
3064 return false;
3065 }
3066 result = false;
3067 sees_player = false;
3068 is_player = false;
3069 attitude = Creature::A_ANY;
3070 const monster *m = dynamic_cast<const monster *>( &critter );
3071 if( m != nullptr ) {
3072 const auto ent_category = C_MONSTER;
3073 std::string ent_subcategory = empty_string;
3074 if( !m->type->species.empty() ) {
3075 ent_subcategory = m->type->species.begin()->str();
3076 }
3077 const int subtile = corner;
3078 // depending on the toggle flip sprite left or right
3079 int rot_facing = -1;
3080 if( m->facing == FD_RIGHT ) {
3081 rot_facing = 0;
3082 } else if( m->facing == FD_LEFT ) {
3083 rot_facing = 4;
3084 }
3085 if( rot_facing >= 0 ) {
3086 const auto ent_name = m->type->id;
3087 std::string chosen_id = ent_name.str();
3088 if( m->has_effect( effect_ridden ) ) {
3089 int pl_under_height = 6;
3090 if( m->mounted_player ) {
3091 draw_entity_with_overlays( *m->mounted_player, p, ll, pl_under_height );
3092 }
3093 const std::string prefix = "rid_";
3094 std::string copy_id = chosen_id;
3095 const std::string ridden_id = copy_id.insert( 0, prefix );
3096 const tile_type *tt = tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( ridden_id );
3097 if( tt ) {
3098 chosen_id = ridden_id;
3099 }
3100 }
3101 result = draw_from_id_string( chosen_id, ent_category, ent_subcategory, p, subtile, rot_facing,
3102 ll, false, height_3d, z_drop );
3103 sees_player = m->sees( g->u );
3104 attitude = m->attitude_to( g-> u );
3105 }
3106 }
3107 const player *pl = dynamic_cast<const player *>( &critter );
3108 if( pl != nullptr ) {
3109 draw_entity_with_overlays( *pl, p, ll, height_3d );
3110 result = true;
3111 if( pl->is_player() ) {
3112 is_player = true;
3113 } else {
3114 sees_player = pl->sees( g-> u );
3115 attitude = pl->attitude_to( g-> u );
3116 }
3117 }
3118 } else {
3119 // invisible
3120 const Creature *critter = g->critter_at( p, true );
3121 if( critter && ( g->u.sees_with_infrared( *critter ) || g->u.sees_with_specials( *critter ) ) ) {
3122 // try drawing infrared creature if invisible and not overridden
3123 // return directly without drawing overlay
3124 return draw_from_id_string( "infrared_creature", C_NONE, empty_string, p, 0, 0,
3125 lit_level::LIT, false, height_3d, z_drop );
3126 } else {
3127 return false;
3128 }
3129 }
3130
3131 if( result && !is_player ) {
3132 std::string draw_id = "overlay_" + Creature::attitude_raw_string( attitude );
3133 if( sees_player ) {
3134 draw_id += "_sees_player";
3135 }
3136 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( draw_id ) ) {
3137 draw_from_id_string( draw_id, C_NONE, empty_string, p, 0, 0, lit_level::LIT, false, height_3d,
3138 z_drop );
3139 }
3140 }
3141 return result;
3142
3143}
3144
3145bool cata_tiles::draw_zone_mark( const tripoint &p, lit_level ll, int &height_3d,
3146 const bool ( &invisible )[5], int z_drop )
3147{
3148 if( invisible[0] ) {
3149 return false;
3150 }
3151
3152 if( !g->is_zones_manager_open() ) {
3153 return false;
3154 }
3155
3156 const zone_manager &mgr = zone_manager::get_manager();
3157 const tripoint &abs = get_map().getabs( p );
3158 const auto zone = mgr.get_bottom_zone( abs );
3159
3160 if( zone && zone->has_options() ) {
3161 auto option = dynamic_cast<const mark_option *>( &zone->get_options() );
3162
3163 if( option && !option->get_mark().empty() ) {
3164 return draw_from_id_string( option->get_mark(), C_NONE, empty_string, p, 0, 0, ll,
3165 nv_goggles_activated, height_3d, z_drop );
3166 }
3167 }
3168
3169 return false;
3170}
3171
3172bool cata_tiles::draw_zombie_revival_indicators( const tripoint &pos, const lit_level /*ll*/,
3173 int &/*height_3d*/, const bool ( &invisible )[5], int z_drop )
3174{
3175 map &here = get_map();
3176 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( ZOMBIE_REVIVAL_INDICATOR ) && !invisible[0] &&
3177 item_override.find( pos ) == item_override.end() && here.could_see_items( pos, g->u ) ) {
3178 for( auto &i : here.i_at( pos ) ) {
3179 if( i.can_revive() ) {
3180 return draw_from_id_string( ZOMBIE_REVIVAL_INDICATOR, C_NONE, empty_string, pos, 0, 0,
3181 lit_level::LIT, false, z_drop );
3182 }
3183 }
3184 }
3185 return false;
3186}
3187
3188void cata_tiles::draw_entity_with_overlays( const Character &ch, const tripoint &p, lit_level ll,
3189 int &height_3d )
3190{
3191 std::string ent_name;
3192
3193 if( ch.is_npc() ) {
3194 ent_name = ch.male ? "npc_male" : "npc_female";
3195 } else {
3196 ent_name = ch.male ? "player_male" : "player_female";
3197 }
3198 // first draw the character itself(i guess this means a tileset that
3199 // takes this seriously needs a naked sprite)
3200 int prev_height_3d = height_3d;
3201
3202 // depending on the toggle flip sprite left or right
3203 if( ch.facing == FD_RIGHT ) {
3204 draw_from_id_string( ent_name, C_NONE, "", p, corner, 0, ll, false, height_3d, 0 );
3205 } else if( ch.facing == FD_LEFT ) {
3206 draw_from_id_string( ent_name, C_NONE, "", p, corner, 4, ll, false, height_3d, 0 );
3207 }
3208
3209 // next up, draw all the overlays
3210 std::vector<std::string> overlays = ch.get_overlay_ids();
3211 for( const std::string &overlay : overlays ) {
3212 std::string draw_id = overlay;
3213 if( find_overlay_looks_like( ch.male, overlay, draw_id ) ) {
3214 int overlay_height_3d = prev_height_3d;
3215 if( ch.facing == FD_RIGHT ) {
3216 draw_from_id_string( draw_id, C_NONE, "", p, corner, /*rota:*/ 0, ll, false, overlay_height_3d, 0 );
3217 } else if( ch.facing == FD_LEFT ) {
3218 draw_from_id_string( draw_id, C_NONE, "", p, corner, /*rota:*/ 4, ll, false, overlay_height_3d, 0 );
3219 }
3220 // the tallest height-having overlay is the one that counts
3221 height_3d = std::max( height_3d, overlay_height_3d );
3222 }
3223 }
3224}
3225
3226bool cata_tiles::draw_item_highlight( const tripoint &pos )
3227{
3228 return draw_from_id_string( ITEM_HIGHLIGHT, C_NONE, empty_string, pos, 0, 0,
3229 lit_level::LIT, false, 0 );
3230}
3231
3232void tileset_loader::ensure_default_item_highlight()
3233{
3234 if( ts.find_tile_type( ITEM_HIGHLIGHT ) ) {
3235 return;
3236 }
3237 const Uint8 highlight_alpha = 127;
3238
3239 int index = ts.tile_values.size();
3240
3241 const SDL_Surface_Ptr surface = create_surface_32( ts.tile_width, ts.tile_height );
3242 assert( surface );
3243 throwErrorIf( SDL_FillRect( surface.get(), nullptr, SDL_MapRGBA( surface->format, 0, 0, 127,
3244 highlight_alpha ) ) != 0, "SDL_FillRect failed" );
3245 ts.tile_values.emplace_back( CreateTextureFromSurface( renderer, surface ), SDL_Rect{ 0, 0, ts.tile_width, ts.tile_height } );
3246 ts.tile_ids[ITEM_HIGHLIGHT].fg.add( std::vector<int>( {index} ), 1 );
3247}

3459bool cata_tiles::has_draw_override( const tripoint &p ) const
3460{
3461 return radiation_override.find( p ) != radiation_override.end() ||
3462 terrain_override.find( p ) != terrain_override.end() ||
3463 furniture_override.find( p ) != furniture_override.end() ||
3464 graffiti_override.find( p ) != graffiti_override.end() ||
3465 trap_override.find( p ) != trap_override.end() ||
3466 field_override.find( p ) != field_override.end() ||
3467 item_override.find( p ) != item_override.end() ||
3468 vpart_override.find( p ) != vpart_override.end() ||
3469 draw_below_override.find( p ) != draw_below_override.end() ||
3470 monster_override.find( p ) != monster_override.end();
3471}
3472/* -- Animation Renders */
3473void cata_tiles::draw_explosion_frame()
3474{
3475 int subtile = 0;
3476 int rotation = 0;
3477
3478 for( int i = 1; i < exp_rad; ++i ) {
3479 subtile = corner;
3480 rotation = 0;
3481
3482 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( -i, -i ),
3483 subtile, rotation++, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated, 0 );
3484 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( -i, i ),
3485 subtile, rotation++, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated, 0 );
3486 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( i, i ),
3487 subtile, rotation++, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated, 0 );
3488 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( i, -i ),
3489 subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated, 0 );
3490
3491 subtile = edge;
3492 for( int j = 1 - i; j < 0 + i; j++ ) {
3493 rotation = 0;
3494 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( j, -i ),
3495 subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated, 0 );
3496 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( j, i ),
3497 subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated, 0 );
3498
3499 rotation = 1;
3500 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( -i, j ),
3501 subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated, 0 );
3502 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, exp_pos + point( i, j ),
3503 subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated, 0 );
3504 }
3505 }
3506}

3508void cata_tiles::draw_custom_explosion_frame()
3509{
3510 // TODO: Make the drawing code handle all the missing tiles: <^>v and *
3511 // TODO: Add more explosion tiles, like "strong explosion", so that it displays more info
3512
3513 // explosion_weak/explosion_medium/explosion removed from tiles in favor of allowing custom explosion sprites.
3514
3515 int subtile = 0;
3516 int rotation = 0;
3517
3518 for( const auto &pr : custom_explosion_layer ) {
3519 const explosion_neighbors ngh = pr.second.neighborhood;
3520
3521 switch( ngh ) {
3522 case N_NORTH:
3523 case N_SOUTH:
3524 subtile = edge;
3525 rotation = 1;
3526 break;
3527 case N_WEST:
3528 case N_EAST:
3529 subtile = edge;
3530 rotation = 0;
3531 break;
3532 case N_NORTH | N_SOUTH:
3533 case N_NORTH | N_SOUTH | N_WEST:
3534 case N_NORTH | N_SOUTH | N_EAST:
3535 subtile = edge;
3536 rotation = 1;
3537 break;
3538 case N_WEST | N_EAST:
3539 case N_WEST | N_EAST | N_NORTH:
3540 case N_WEST | N_EAST | N_SOUTH:
3541 subtile = edge;
3542 rotation = 0;
3543 break;
3544 case N_SOUTH | N_EAST:
3545 subtile = corner;
3546 rotation = 0;
3547 break;
3548 case N_NORTH | N_EAST:
3549 subtile = corner;
3550 rotation = 1;
3551 break;
3552 case N_NORTH | N_WEST:
3553 subtile = corner;
3554 rotation = 2;
3555 break;
3556 case N_SOUTH | N_WEST:
3557 subtile = corner;
3558 rotation = 3;
3559 break;
3560 case N_NO_NEIGHBORS:
3561 subtile = edge;
3562 break;
3563 case N_WEST | N_EAST | N_NORTH | N_SOUTH:
3564 // Needs some special tile
3565 subtile = edge;
3566 break;
3567 }
3568
3569 const tripoint &p = pr.first;
3570 draw_from_id_string( exp_name, p, subtile, rotation, lit_level::LIT, nv_goggles_activated, 0 );
3571 // Used to be divided into explosion_weak/explosion_medium/explosion.
3572 }
3573}
3574void cata_tiles::draw_cone_aoe_frame()
3575{
3576 for( const point_with_value &pv : cone_aoe_layer ) {
3577 const tripoint diff = pv.pt - cone_aoe_origin;
3578 int rotation = ( sgn( diff.x ) == sgn( diff.y ) ? 1 : 0 );
3579 // Should probably jsonize for flamethrower, dragon breath etc.
3580 static const std::array<std::string, 3> sprite_ids = {{
3581 "shot_cone_weak",
3582 "shot_cone_medium",
3583 "shot_cone_strong"
3584 }
3585 };
3586
3587 size_t intensity = ( pv.val >= 1.0 ) + ( pv.val >= 0.5 );
3588 draw_from_id_string( sprite_ids[intensity], pv.pt, 0, rotation, lit_level::LIT, false, 0 );
3589 }
3590}

3650
3651void cata_tiles::draw_sct_frame( std::multimap<point, formatted_text> &overlay_strings )
3652{
3653 const bool use_font = get_option<bool>( "ANIMATION_SCT_USE_FONT" );
3654
3655 for( auto iter = SCT.vSCT.begin(); iter != SCT.vSCT.end(); ++iter ) {
3656 const point iD( iter->getPosX(), iter->getPosY() );
3657 const int full_text_length = utf8_width( iter->getText() );
3658
3659 int iOffsetX = 0;
3660 int iOffsetY = 0;
3661
3662 for( int j = 0; j < 2; ++j ) {
3663 std::string sText = iter->getText( ( j == 0 ) ? "first" : "second" );
3664 int FG = msgtype_to_tilecolor( iter->getMsgType( ( j == 0 ) ? "first" : "second" ),
3665 iter->getStep() >= SCT.iMaxSteps / 2 );
3666
3667 if( use_font ) {
3668 const auto direction = iter->getDirecton();
3669 // Compensate for string length offset added at SCT creation
3670 // (it will be readded using font size and proper encoding later).
3671 const int direction_offset = ( -direction_XY( direction ).x + 1 ) * full_text_length / 2;
3672
3673 overlay_strings.emplace(
3674 player_to_screen( iD + point( direction_offset, 0 ) ),
3675 formatted_text( sText, FG, direction ) );
3676 } else {
3677 for( auto &it : sText ) {
3678 const std::string generic_id = get_ascii_tile_id( it, FG, -1 );
3679
3680 if( tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( generic_id ) ) {
3681 draw_from_id_string( generic_id, C_NONE, empty_string,
3682 iD + tripoint( iOffsetX, iOffsetY, g->u.pos().z ), 0, 0, lit_level::LIT, false, 0 );
3683 }
3684
3685 if( tile_iso ) {
3686 iOffsetY++;
3687 }
3688 iOffsetX++;
3689 }
3690 }
3691 }
3692 }
3693}

3729
3730void cata_tiles::get_terrain_orientation( const tripoint &p, int &rota, int &subtile,
3731 const std::map<tripoint, ter_id> &ter_override, const bool ( &invisible )[5] )
3732{
3733 map &here = get_map();
3734 const bool overridden = ter_override.find( p ) != ter_override.end();
3735 const auto ter = [&]( const tripoint & q, const bool invis ) -> ter_id {
3736 const auto override = ter_override.find( q );
3737 return override != ter_override.end() ? override->second :
3738 ( !overridden || !invis ) ? here.ter( q ) : t_null;
3739 };
3740
3741 // get terrain at x,y
3742 const ter_id tid = ter( p, invisible[0] );
3743 if( tid == t_null ) {
3744 subtile = 0;
3745 rota = 0;
3746 return;
3747 }
3748
3749 // get terrain neighborhood
3750 const ter_id neighborhood[4] = {
3751 ter( p + point_south, invisible[1] ),
3752 ter( p + point_east, invisible[2] ),
3753 ter( p + point_west, invisible[3] ),
3754 ter( p + point_north, invisible[4] )
3755 };
3756
3757 char val = 0;
3758
3759 // populate connection information
3760 for( int i = 0; i < 4; ++i ) {
3761 if( neighborhood[i] == tid ) {
3762 val += 1 << i;
3763 }
3764 }
3765
3766 get_rotation_and_subtile( val, rota, subtile );
3767}
3768
3769void cata_tiles::get_rotation_and_subtile( const char val, int &rotation, int &subtile )
3770{
3771 switch( val ) {
3772 // no connections
3773 case 0:
3774 subtile = unconnected;
3775 rotation = 0;
3776 break;
3777 // all connections
3778 case 15:
3779 subtile = center;
3780 rotation = 0;
3781 break;
3782 // end pieces
3783 case 8:
3784 subtile = end_piece;
3785 rotation = 2;
3786 break;
3787 case 4:
3788 subtile = end_piece;
3789 rotation = 3;
3790 break;
3791 case 2:
3792 subtile = end_piece;
3793 rotation = 1;
3794 break;
3795 case 1:
3796 subtile = end_piece;
3797 rotation = 0;
3798 break;
3799 // edges
3800 case 9:
3801 subtile = edge;
3802 rotation = 0;
3803 break;
3804 case 6:
3805 subtile = edge;
3806 rotation = 1;
3807 break;
3808 // corners
3809 case 12:
3810 subtile = corner;
3811 rotation = 2;
3812 break;
3813 case 10:
3814 subtile = corner;
3815 rotation = 1;
3816 break;
3817 case 3:
3818 subtile = corner;
3819 rotation = 0;
3820 break;
3821 case 5:
3822 subtile = corner;
3823 rotation = 3;
3824 break;
3825 // all t_connections
3826 case 14:
3827 subtile = t_connection;
3828 rotation = 2;
3829 break;
3830 case 11:
3831 subtile = t_connection;
3832 rotation = 1;
3833 break;
3834 case 7:
3835 subtile = t_connection;
3836 rotation = 0;
3837 break;
3838 case 13:
3839 subtile = t_connection;
3840 rotation = 3;
3841 break;
3842 }
3843}
3844
3845void cata_tiles::get_connect_values( const tripoint &p, int &subtile, int &rotation,
3846 const int connect_group, const std::map<tripoint, ter_id> &ter_override )
3847{
3848 uint8_t connections = get_map().get_known_connections( p, connect_group, ter_override );
3849 get_rotation_and_subtile( connections, rotation, subtile );
3850}
3851
3852void cata_tiles::get_tile_values( const int t, const int *tn, int &subtile, int &rotation )
3853{
3854 bool connects[4];
3855 char val = 0;
3856 for( int i = 0; i < 4; ++i ) {
3857 connects[i] = ( tn[i] == t );
3858 if( connects[i] ) {
3859 val += 1 << i;
3860 }
3861 }
3862 get_rotation_and_subtile( val, rotation, subtile );
3863}
3864
3865void cata_tiles::do_tile_loading_report( std::function<void( std::string )> out )
3866{
3867 out( "Loaded tileset: " + get_option<std::string>( "TILES" ) );
3868
3869 if( !init::is_data_loaded() ) {
3870 // There's nothing to do anymore without the core data.
3871 return;
3872 }
3873
3874 tile_loading_report<ter_t>( ter_t::count(), C_TERRAIN, out, "" );
3875 tile_loading_report<furn_t>( furn_t::count(), C_FURNITURE, out, "" );
3876
3877 std::map<itype_id, const itype *> items;
3878 for( const itype *e : item_controller->all() ) {
3879 items.emplace( e->get_id(), e );
3880 }
3881 tile_loading_report( items, C_ITEM, out, "" );
3882
3883 auto mtypes = MonsterGenerator::generator().get_all_mtypes();
3884 lr_generic( mtypes.begin(), mtypes.end(), []( const std::vector<mtype>::iterator & m ) {
3885 return ( *m ).id.str();
3886 }, C_MONSTER, out, "" );
3887 tile_loading_report( vpart_info::all(), C_VEHICLE_PART, out, "vp_" );
3888 tile_loading_report<trap>( trap::count(), C_TRAP, out, "" );
3889 tile_loading_report<field_type>( field_type::count(), C_FIELD, out, "" );
3890}
3891
3892point cata_tiles::player_to_screen( const point &p ) const
3893{
3894 point screen;
3895 if( tile_iso ) {
3896 screen.x = ( ( p.x - o.x ) - ( o.y - p.y ) + screentile_width - 2 ) * tile_width / 2 +
3897 op.x;
3898 // y uses tile_width because width is definitive for iso tiles
3899 // tile footprints are half as tall as wide, arbitrarily tall
3900 screen.y = ( ( p.y - o.y ) - ( p.x - o.x ) - 4 ) * tile_width / 4 +
3901 screentile_height * tile_height / 2 + // TODO: more obvious centering math
3902 op.y;
3903 } else {
3904 screen.x = ( p.x - o.x ) * tile_width + op.x;
3905 screen.y = ( p.y - o.y ) * tile_height + op.y;
3906 }
3907 return {screen};
3908}
3909
3910template<typename Iter, typename Func>
3911void cata_tiles::lr_generic( Iter begin, Iter end, Func id_func, TILE_CATEGORY category,
3912 std::function<void( std::string )> out, const std::string &prefix )
3913{
3914 std::string missing_list;
3915 std::string missing_with_looks_like_list;
3916 for( ; begin != end; ++begin ) {
3917 const std::string id_string = id_func( begin );
3918
3919 if( !tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( prefix + id_string ) &&
3920 !find_tile_looks_like( id_string, category ) ) {
3921 missing_list.append( id_string + " " );
3922 } else if( !tileset_ptr->find_tile_type( prefix + id_string ) ) {
3923 missing_with_looks_like_list.append( id_string + " " );
3924 }
3925 }
3926 out( "Missing " + TILE_CATEGORY_IDS[category] + ": " + missing_list );
3927 out( "Missing " + TILE_CATEGORY_IDS[category] + " (but looks_like tile exists): " +
3928 missing_with_looks_like_list );
3929}
3930
3931template <typename maptype>
3932void cata_tiles::tile_loading_report( const maptype &tiletypemap, TILE_CATEGORY category,
3933 std::function<void( std::string )> out, const std::string &prefix )
3934{
3935 lr_generic( tiletypemap.begin(), tiletypemap.end(),
3936 []( const decltype( tiletypemap.begin() ) & v ) {
3937 // c_str works for std::string and for string_id!
3938 return v->first.c_str();
3939 }, category, out, prefix );
3940}
3941
3942template <typename base_type>
3943void cata_tiles::tile_loading_report( const size_t count, TILE_CATEGORY category,
3944 std::function<void( std::string )> out, const std::string &prefix )
3945{
3946 lr_generic( static_cast<size_t>( 0 ), count,
3947 []( const size_t i ) {
3948 return int_id<base_type>( i ).id().str();
3949 }, category, out, prefix );
3950}
3951
3952template <typename arraytype>
3953void cata_tiles::tile_loading_report( const arraytype &array, int array_length,
3954 TILE_CATEGORY category, std::function<void( std::string )> out, const std::string &prefix )
3955{
3956 const auto begin = &( array[0] );
3957 lr_generic( begin, begin + array_length,
3958 []( decltype( begin ) const v ) {
3959 return v->id;
3960 }, category, out, prefix );
3961}
3962
3963std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> cata_tiles::build_renderer_list()
3964{
3965 std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> renderer_names;
3966 std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> default_renderer_names = {
3967# if defined(_WIN32)
3968 { "direct3d", translate_marker( "direct3d" ) },
3969# endif
3970 { "software", translate_marker( "software" ) },
3971 { "opengl", translate_marker( "opengl" ) },
3972 { "opengles2", translate_marker( "opengles2" ) },
3973 };
3974 int numRenderDrivers = SDL_GetNumRenderDrivers();
3975 DebugLog( DL::Info, DC::Main ) << "Number of render drivers on your system: " << numRenderDrivers;
3976 for( int ii = 0; ii < numRenderDrivers; ii++ ) {
3977 SDL_RendererInfo ri;
3978 SDL_GetRenderDriverInfo( ii, &ri );
3979 DebugLog( DL::Info, DC::Main ) << "Render driver: " << ii << "/" << ri.name;
3980 // First default renderer name we will put first on the list. We can use it later as default value.
3981 if( ri.name == default_renderer_names.front().first ) {
3982 renderer_names.emplace( renderer_names.begin(), default_renderer_names.front() );
3983 } else {
3984 renderer_names.emplace_back( ri.name, ri.name );
3985 }
3986
3987 }
3988
3989 return renderer_names.empty() ? default_renderer_names : renderer_names;
3990}
3991
3992std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> cata_tiles::build_display_list()
3993{
3994 std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> display_names;
3995 std::vector<options_manager::id_and_option> default_display_names = {
3996 { "0", translate_marker( "Display 0" ) }
3997 };
3998
3999 int numdisplays = SDL_GetNumVideoDisplays();
4000 for( int i = 0 ; i < numdisplays ; i++ ) {
4001 display_names.emplace_back( std::to_string( i ), std::string( SDL_GetDisplayName( i ) ) );
4002 }
4003
4004 return display_names.empty() ? default_display_names : display_names;
4005}
